Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

zlevel.descriptionCN:
zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

left.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the left side of the container.

left value can be specific pixel value like20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container width like '20%' , and also 'left', 'center', 'right'.

if the left value is'left', 'center', 'right', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

top.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the upper side of the container.

top value can be specific pixel value like 20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%', and also 'top', 'middle', 'bottom'. if the top value is'top', 'middle', 'bottom', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

right.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the right side of the container.

right value can be specific pixel value like 20 ,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

bottom.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the down side of the container.

bottom value can be specific pixel value like 20,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

parallel.descriptionCN:
Introduction of parallel coordinates

parallel coordinates (Parallel Coordinates) is a frequently used data chart of high-dimensional visualization.

For example, following data are in series-parallel.data : 

[
    [1,  55,  9,   56,  0.46,  18,  6,  'good'],
    [2,  25,  11,  21,  0.65,  34,  9,  'excellent'],
    [3,  56,  7,   63,  0.3,   14,  5,  'good'],
    [4,  33,  7,   29,  0.33,  16,  6,  'excellent'],
    { // data item can also be Object, therefore special setting of lines can be included.
        value: [5,  42,  24,  44,  0.76,  40,  16, 'excellent']
        lineStyle: {...},
    }
    ...
]

In data, every line is a data item, every row belongs to adimension. (like every row of data above means: date,AQI index, PM2.5, PM10, carbon monoxide value, nitrogen dioxide value, sulfur dioxide value).

Parallel coordinate is suited to conduct visualization analysis on multidimensional data. Every dimension (row) corresponds to an axis, everydata itemis a line, going through multiple axes. In this axis, data selection and other operations can be carried out, as following:

brief introduction of configuration mode

basic configurations of option inparallel coordinatesare as followed: 

option = {
    parallelAxis: [                     // These are definitions of numerous axis
        {dim: 0, name: schema[0].text}, // Everyaxishas a 'dim' attribute, representing dimension number of axis.
        {dim: 1, name: schema[1].text},
        {dim: 2, name: schema[2].text},
        {dim: 3, name: schema[3].text},
        {dim: 4, name: schema[4].text},
        {dim: 5, name: schema[5].text},
        {dim: 6, name: schema[6].text},
        {dim: 7, name: schema[7].text,
            type: 'category',           //Axis also support category data 
            data: ['Excellent', 'good', 'light pollution', 'moderate pollution', 'heavy pollution', 'severe pollution']
        }
    ],
    parallel: {                         // This is the definition ofcoordinate
        left: '5%',                     // Location setting of parallel coordinate
        right: '13%',
        bottom: '10%',
        top: '20%',
        parallelAxisDefault: {          // Public attribute of axiscan be set here to aviod repeated writing.
            type: 'value',
            nameLocation: 'end',
            nameGap: 20
        }
    },
    series: [                           // These three series share one parallel coordinate
        {
            name: 'Beijing',
            type: 'parallel',           // The type of this series is 'parallel'
            data: [
                [1,  55,  9,   56,  0.46,  18,  6,  'good'],
                [2,  25,  11,  21,  0.65,  34,  9,  'excellent'],
                ...
            ]
        },
        {
            name: 'Shanghai',
            type: 'parallel',
            data: [
                [3,  56,  7,   63,  0.3,   14,  5,  'good'],
                [4,  33,  7,   29,  0.33,  16,  6,  'excellent'],
                ...
            ]
        },
        {
            name: 'Guangzhou',
            type: 'parallel',
            data: [
                [4,  33,  7,   29,  0.33,  16,  6,  'excellent'],
                [5,  42,  24,  44,  0.76,  40,  16, 'excellent'],
                ...
            ]
        }
    ]
};

Three concerned components: parallelparallelAxisseries-parallel

  • parallel

    The configuration item of this parallel coordinate iscoordinateitsel.one series (series) or many series (like BeijingShanghaiGuangzhouin the above picture is a series respectively.) They can share thicoordinate

    The same as other coordinates, multiple coordinates can be created.

    Location setting is also carried out here.

  • parallelAxis

    This is axis configuration of coordinate. Naturally, multiple axes are needed.

    Among which are attributes of parallelAxis.parallelIndex, assigning thisaxisin whichcoordinate. Use the first coordinateby default.

  • series-parallel

    This is the definition ofseries. Series will be drawn tocoordinate.

    Among which are attributes of series-parallel.parallelIndex, assigning usage of whichcoordinate.Use the first coordinateby default.

Configuration note and best practices

When configure multiple parallelAxis, there are some value share the same attribute, If write them multiple times is complicated, then they could be placed in parallel.parallelAxisDefault. Before initializing axis, configuration item in parallelAxisDefault will integrate into parallelAxis respectively, and finally form the configuration of axis.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

left.descriptionCN:
parallel distance of component from the left side of the container.

left value can be specific pixel value like20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container width like '20%' , and also 'left', 'center', 'right'.

if the left value is'left', 'center', 'right', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

top.descriptionCN:
parallel distance of component from the upper side of the container.

top value can be specific pixel value like 20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%', and also 'top', 'middle', 'bottom'. if the top value is'top', 'middle', 'bottom', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

right.descriptionCN:
parallel distance of component from the right side of the container.

right value can be specific pixel value like 20 ,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

bottom.descriptionCN:
parallel distance of component from the down side of the container.

bottom value can be specific pixel value like 20,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

layout.descriptionCN:
layout modes, optional values are:

  • 'horizontal': horizontally configurate every coordinate axis.

  • 'vertical': vertically configurate every coordinate axis.

parallelAxisDefault.descriptionCN:
When configure multiple parallelAxis, there are some value share the same attribute, If write them multiple times is complicated, then they could be placed in parallel.parallelAxisDefault. Before initializing axis, configuration item in parallelAxisDefault will integrate into parallelAxis respectively, and finally form the configuration of axis.

See the sample

type.descriptionCN:
Type of axis

Option:

  • 'value' numerical axis, suitable for continuous data.

  • 'category' category axis, suitable for discrete category data, only can set category data through data.

  • 'time' timeaxis, suitable for continuous time series data, has a feature of time formatting and a different tick calculation method when compared with numerical axis.For instance, it would decide to adopt month, week, day or hour to be the tick unit in terms of the range of span.

  • 'log' log axis,suitable for log data.

nameTextStyle.descriptionCN: The text style of the name for coordinate axis.

color.descriptionCN: the name of coordinate axistext color.

fontStyle.descriptionCN:
the name of coordinate axisFont style

Options are:

  • 'normal'
  • 'italic'
  • 'oblique'

fontWeight.descriptionCN:
the name of coordinate axisFont thickness

Options are:

  • 'normal'
  • 'bold'
  • 'bolder'
  • 'lighter'
  • 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

nameGap.descriptionCN: The distance between the name of coordinate axis and axis line.

inverse.descriptionCN: Specify whether it is inverse coordinate axis. New option in ECharts 3.

boundaryGap.descriptionCN:
The boundary gap on both sides of the coordinate axis. The setting and performance of category axis and non-category axis are different.

The boundaryGap of category axis can be allocated as true and false, which defauts to be allocated as true. Meanwhile, axisTickcan be used only as splitline. Both the label and data marker exist on the band between 2 axis tick.

non-category axis includes time, numerical value, log axis. boundaryGap is an array consisting of 2 values which individually refer to the span range between the maximun and minimum value. The value and the percentage can be directly set. boundaryGap is not available after the min and max being set. example: 

boundaryGap: ['20%', '20%']

min.descriptionCN:
The minimun value of axistick is unavailable in category axis.

It can be set as particular value 'dataMin'. Meanwhile, the minmum value in this axis is fetched as the minmun tick.

max.descriptionCN:
The maximum value of axistick is unavailable in category axis.

It can be set as particular value 'dataMax'. Meanwhile, the maximum value in this axis is fetched as the maximum tick.

without a particular setting, the maximum value would be caculated automatically to make sure the uniform distribution of axis ticks.

scale.descriptionCN:
It is available only in numerical axis (type: 'value').

specify whether to get rid of 0 value porpotion. As it is set as true, the axis tick would not compulsorily contains 0 scale, which is more useful in the scatter diagram of double-numerical axis.

This configuration item is unavailable as the min and max are set.

splitNumber.descriptionCN:
SplitNumber. It should be noticed that this splitNumber is just a predicted value. The finally displayed split number results from the adjustment based on the readability of axis tick which is shown after being segmented.
unavailable in category axis.

interval.descriptionCN:
The segmented interval of coordinate axis.

As splitNumber is a predicted value, the scale caculated through pratical strategy may not achieve the desired effect. Under such condition, interval can be set with min, max to compulsorily divide the scale, which is generally not recommended.

Unavailable in category axis. The timestamp need to be transmitted in timeaxis (type: 'time'), and the index value need to be transmitted in logaxis. (type: 'log').

show.descriptionCN: To show the axis line or not.

color.descriptionCN:
axisLineline color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

axisTick.descriptionCN: The related settings about the axis tick

show.descriptionCN: Specify whether to show the axis tick.

interval.descriptionCN:
axisTick, available in category axis. defaults to be the same as axisLabel.interval.

It defaults to adopt strategic interval to show the labels in case labels repeat, which could be set as 0 to compulsorily display all the labels.

The interval data not only could be presented by numerical value, but also could be controled through callback function.The format of callback function is shown as follow: 

(index:number, value: string) => boolean

The first parameter is the index of category, and the second value is the name of the category. If it is skipped, it would be back to false.

inside.descriptionCN: specify the axis tick are inside oriented. It defauts to be outside oriented.

color.descriptionCN:
axisTickline color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

axisLabel.descriptionCN: The related settings about the axistick lable

show.descriptionCN: To show the label of axis tick label or not.

interval.descriptionCN:
axisTick label, available in category axis.

It defaults to adopt strategic interval to show the labels in case labels repeat, which could be set as 0 to compulsorily display all the labels.

The interval data not only could be presented by numerical value, but also could be controled through callback function.The format of callback function is shown as follow: 

(index:number, value: string) => boolean

The first parameter is the index of category, and the second value is the name of the category. If it is skipped, it would be back to false.

inside.descriptionCN: Specify whether the axisTick label is inside oriented. It defaults to be outside oriented.

rotate.descriptionCN:
The rotation angle of the tick label. As the category labels in the category axis cannot be shown completely, you can rotate the tick labels to prevent them from overlapping each other.

The rotation angle is from -90 degree to 90 degree.

margin.descriptionCN: The margin between the tick lable and the axis.

formatter.descriptionCN:
The formatter of axi stick label, supporting both string template and callback fuction.

Example:

//using string template, the template variable is the default label of axistick  {value}
formatter: '{value} kg'

// using callback function template, function parameters are individually
formatter: function (value, index) {
    // formatting to be Month/day, the particular year display only in the first scale
    var date = new Date(value);
    var texts = [(date.getMonth() + 1), date.getDate()];
    if (idx === 0) {
        texts.unshift(date.getYear());
    }
    return texts.join('/');
}

color.descriptionCN: text color.

data.descriptionCN:
Category data, available in category axis (type: 'category').

Example: 

//Name list of all categories
data: ['Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday', 'Sunday']
// Each item could also be a specific configuration item. Under this condition, `value` in the configuration should be adopted as the category name 
data: [{
    value: 'Monday',
    // highlight Monday
    textStyle: {
        fontSize: 20,
        color: 'red'
    }
}, 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday', 'Sunday']

color.descriptionCN: text color.

align.descriptionCN:
Horizontal Alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:

  • 'left'
  • 'center'
  • 'right'

baseline.descriptionCN:
Baseline Alignment of text, automatic by default. Options are:

  • 'top'
  • 'middle'
  • 'bottom'

This component is the coordinate axis in parallel coordinate.

Introduction of parallel coordinates

parallel coordinates (Parallel Coordinates) is a frequently used data chart of high-dimensional visualization.

        lineStyle: {...},
    }
    ...
]

In data, every line is a data item, every row belongs to adimension. (like every row of data above means: date,AQI index, PM2.5, PM10, carbon monoxide value, nitrogen dioxide value, sulfur dioxide value).

        {dim: 2, name: schema[2].text},
        {dim: 3, name: schema[3].text},
        {dim: 4, name: schema[4].text},
        {dim: 5, name: schema[5].text},

            type: 'category',           //Axis also support category data

};

Three concerned components: parallelparallelAxisseries-parallel

Configuration note and best practices

When configure multiple parallelAxis, there are some value share the same attribute, If write them multiple times is complicated, then they could be placed in parallel.parallelAxisDefault. Before initializing axis, configuration item in parallelAxisDefault will integrate into parallelAxis respectively, and finally form the configuration of axis.

dim.descriptionCN:
The dimension number of coordinate axis.

For example, following data are in series-parallel.data : 

[
    [1,  55,  9,   56,  0.46,  18,  6,  'good'],
    [2,  25,  11,  21,  0.65,  34,  9,  'excellent'],
    [3,  56,  7,   63,  0.3,   14,  5,  'good'],
    [4,  33,  7,   29,  0.33,  16,  6,  'excellent'],
    { // data item can also be Object, therefore special setting of lines can be included.
        value: [5,  42,  24,  44,  0.76,  40,  16, 'excellent']
        lineStyle: {...},
    }
    ...
]

In data, every line is a data item, every row belongs to adimension. (like every row of data above means: date,AQI index, PM2.5, PM10, carbon monoxide value, nitrogen dioxide value, sulfur dioxide value).

dim defines which dimension (whichrow) of data would correspond to this coordinate axis.

Count from 0. For example, the dim of coordinate axis is 1, indicating that the second row of data would correspond to this coordinate axis.

parallelIndex.descriptionCN:
It is used to define which coordinatethecoordinate axisshould correspond to.

For example, there is the following configuration: 

myChart.setOption({
    parallel: [
        {...},                      // the first parallel coordinate
        {...}                       //  the second parallel coordinate
    ],
    parallelAxis: [
        {parallelIndex: 1, ...},    // the first coordinate axis, corresponding to the second parallel coordinate
        {parallelIndex: 0, ...},    //  the second coordinate axis, corresponding to the first parallel coordinate
        {parallelIndex: 1, ...},    //  the third coordinate axis, corresponding to the second parallel coordinate
        {parallelIndex: 0, ...}     //  the fourth coordinate axis, corresponding to the first parallel coordinate
    ],
    ...
});

If there is only one parallel coordinate, the setting could be ignored, which defaults to be 0.

areaSelectStyle.descriptionCN: Area selecting is available on coordinate axis. Here is some settings about area selecting.

width.descriptionCN: The width of the range of area selecting.

borderWidth.descriptionCN: The border width of the marquee.

borderColor.descriptionCN: The border color of the marquee.

color.descriptionCN: The border fill color of the marquee.

opacity.descriptionCN: The transparency of the marquee.

  • 'normal'
  • 'bold'
  • 'bolder'
  • 'lighter'
  • 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

nameGap.descriptionCN: The distance between the name of coordinate axis and axis line.

inverse.descriptionCN: Specify whether it is inverse coordinate axis. New option in ECharts 3.

boundaryGap.descriptionCN:
The boundary gap on both sides of the coordinate axis. The setting and performance of category axis and non-category axis are different.

The boundaryGap of category axis can be allocated as true and false, which defauts to be allocated as true. Meanwhile, axisTickcan be used only as splitline. Both the label and data marker exist on the band between 2 axis tick.

non-category axis includes time, numerical value, log axis. boundaryGap is an array consisting of 2 values which individually refer to the span range between the maximun and minimum value. The value and the percentage can be directly set. boundaryGap is not available after the min and max being set. example: 

boundaryGap: ['20%', '20%']

min.descriptionCN:
The minimun value of axistick is unavailable in category axis.

It can be set as particular value 'dataMin'. Meanwhile, the minmum value in this axis is fetched as the minmun tick.

max.descriptionCN:
The maximum value of axistick is unavailable in category axis.

It can be set as particular value 'dataMax'. Meanwhile, the maximum value in this axis is fetched as the maximum tick.

without a particular setting, the maximum value would be caculated automatically to make sure the uniform distribution of axis ticks.

scale.descriptionCN:
It is available only in numerical axis (type: 'value').

specify whether to get rid of 0 value porpotion. As it is set as true, the axis tick would not compulsorily contains 0 scale, which is more useful in the scatter diagram of double-numerical axis.

This configuration item is unavailable as the min and max are set.

splitNumber.descriptionCN:
SplitNumber. It should be noticed that this splitNumber is just a predicted value. The finally displayed split number results from the adjustment based on the readability of axis tick which is shown after being segmented.
unavailable in category axis.

interval.descriptionCN:
The segmented interval of coordinate axis.

As splitNumber is a predicted value, the scale caculated through pratical strategy may not achieve the desired effect. Under such condition, interval can be set with min, max to compulsorily divide the scale, which is generally not recommended.

Unavailable in category axis. The timestamp need to be transmitted in timeaxis (type: 'time'), and the index value need to be transmitted in logaxis. (type: 'log').

show.descriptionCN: To show the axis line or not.

color.descriptionCN:
axisLineline color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

axisTick.descriptionCN: The related settings about the axis tick

show.descriptionCN: Specify whether to show the axis tick.

interval.descriptionCN:
axisTick, available in category axis. defaults to be the same as axisLabel.interval.

It defaults to adopt strategic interval to show the labels in case labels repeat, which could be set as 0 to compulsorily display all the labels.

The interval data not only could be presented by numerical value, but also could be controled through callback function.The format of callback function is shown as follow: 

(index:number, value: string) => boolean

The first parameter is the index of category, and the second value is the name of the category. If it is skipped, it would be back to false.

inside.descriptionCN: specify the axis tick are inside oriented. It defauts to be outside oriented.

color.descriptionCN:
axisTickline color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

axisLabel.descriptionCN: The related settings about the axistick lable

show.descriptionCN: To show the label of axis tick label or not.

interval.descriptionCN:
axisTick label, available in category axis.

It defaults to adopt strategic interval to show the labels in case labels repeat, which could be set as 0 to compulsorily display all the labels.

The interval data not only could be presented by numerical value, but also could be controled through callback function.The format of callback function is shown as follow: 

(index:number, value: string) => boolean

The first parameter is the index of category, and the second value is the name of the category. If it is skipped, it would be back to false.

inside.descriptionCN: Specify whether the axisTick label is inside oriented. It defaults to be outside oriented.

rotate.descriptionCN:
The rotation angle of the tick label. As the category labels in the category axis cannot be shown completely, you can rotate the tick labels to prevent them from overlapping each other.

The rotation angle is from -90 degree to 90 degree.

margin.descriptionCN: The margin between the tick lable and the axis.

formatter.descriptionCN:
The formatter of axi stick label, supporting both string template and callback fuction.

Example:

//using string template, the template variable is the default label of axistick  {value}
formatter: '{value} kg'

// using callback function template, function parameters are individually
formatter: function (value, index) {
    // formatting to be Month/day, the particular year display only in the first scale
    var date = new Date(value);
    var texts = [(date.getMonth() + 1), date.getDate()];
    if (idx === 0) {
        texts.unshift(date.getYear());
    }
    return texts.join('/');
}

color.descriptionCN: text color.

data.descriptionCN:
Category data, available in category axis (type: 'category').

Example: 

//Name list of all categories
data: ['Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday', 'Sunday']
// Each item could also be a specific configuration item. Under this condition, `value` in the configuration should be adopted as the category name 
data: [{
    value: 'Monday',
    // highlight Monday
    textStyle: {
        fontSize: 20,
        color: 'red'
    }
}, 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday', 'Sunday']

color.descriptionCN: text color.

align.descriptionCN:
Horizontal Alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:

  • 'left'
  • 'center'
  • 'right'

baseline.descriptionCN:
Baseline Alignment of text, automatic by default. Options are:

  • 'top'
  • 'middle'
  • 'bottom'

timeline.descriptionCN:
timeline component, which provides different operational functions such as switch function between multiple ECharts option and play function.

Here is the example:

Different from other components, timeline component need to operate multiple options timeline . Assume that a traditional ECharts option was called atom option. When timeline is used, the option which is introduced into ECharts becomes a compound option, a collection of multiple atom option. As shown in the following example: 

// as follows, baseOption is a atom option, and every item in options array is also a atom option.
// eachatom optionis a type of configuration items described in this document.
myChart.setOption(
    {
        baseOption: {
            timeline: {
                ...,
                data: ['2002-01-01', '2003-01-01', '2004-01-01']
            },
            title: {
                subtext: ' the data is from National Bureau of Statistics '
            },
            grid: {...},
            xAxis: [...],
            yAxis: [...],
            series: [
                { // other configurations of series 1
                    type: 'bar',
                    ...
                },
                { // other configurations of series 2
                    type: 'line',
                    ...
                },
                { // other configurations of series 3
                    type: 'pie',
                    ...
                }
            ]
        },
        options: [
            { // it is an option corresponding to '2002-01-01'
                title: {
                text: 'the statistics of the year 2002'
                },
                series: [
                    {data: []}, // the data of series 1
                    {data: []}, // the data of series 2
                    {data: []}  // the data of series 3
                ]
            },
            { // it is an option corresponding to '2003-01-01'
                title: {
                    text: 'the statistics of the year 2003'
                },
                series: [
                    {data: []},
                    {data: []},
                    {data: []}
                ]
            },
            { // it is an option corresponding to '2004-01-01' 
                title: {
                    text: 'the statistics of the year 2004'
                },
                series: [
                    {data: []},
                    {data: []},
                    {data: []}
                ]
            }
        ]
    }
);

In the previous examples, every item in timeline.data corresponds to every option of options array.


precautions for use and the best practice:

  • communal configuration item, which is recommended to be allocated in baseOption. As timeline switching and playing, the corresponding option in option array would merge with baseOption to become the final option.

  • In options array, if an array item was allocated with an attribute, every other array item must be allocated with a options, no defaults, or this attribute's operational effect would be left over.


Its compatibility with ECharts2:

  • ECharts3 doesn't support timeline.notMerge parameter, which implies notMerge mode would not be supported any more. If this scene was needed, the option management could be conducted outside with a notMerge setting like setOption(option, true).

  • Comparing ECharts3 with ECharts2, the define locations of their timeline attributes are different. The one in ECharts3 is moved to baseOption and is regarded as a common component, which is also compatible with the timeline difine location of ECharts2. It is just not recommended to be written anymore.

show.descriptionCN: Specify whether to show the timeline component. It would not show under a setting of false, but its function still remains.

type.descriptionCN: At present, this attribute would be valid only if it is set as slider. It's unnecessary to change it.

axisType.descriptionCN:
types of axis. optional values:

  • 'value' value axis, applied to continuous data.

  • 'category' category axis, applied to discrete category data.

  • 'time' time axis, applied to continuous time. Compared with value axis, time axis is equiped with time formatting series data and calculate the scale differently. For example, for time axis, the span range decide whether month, week or day would be the minimum scale.

currentIndex.descriptionCN: Indicating which is the currently selected item. For instance,if currentIndex is 0, it indicates that the currently selected item is timeline.data[0] (namely, using options[0]).

playInterval.descriptionCN: Refers to the play speed(interval between beats ), unit is millisecond(ms) .

realtime.descriptionCN: Whether the view updates in real time during dragging a dot.

controlPosition.descriptionCN: Refer to the location ofplaybuttom. optional values: 'left''right'.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

left.descriptionCN:
timeline distance of component from the left side of the container.

left value can be specific pixel value like20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container width like '20%' , and also 'left', 'center', 'right'.

if the left value is'left', 'center', 'right', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

top.descriptionCN:
timeline distance of component from the upper side of the container.

top value can be specific pixel value like 20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%', and also 'top', 'middle', 'bottom'. if the top value is'top', 'middle', 'bottom', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

right.descriptionCN:
timeline distance of component from the right side of the container.

right value can be specific pixel value like 20 ,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

bottom.descriptionCN:
timeline distance of component from the down side of the container.

bottom value can be specific pixel value like 20,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

padding.descriptionCN:
timeline internal margin, unit as px,set internal margin of each directions to 5 by default, set the internal margin of four directions of accepting array.

Examples: 

// Set internal margin to 5
padding: 5
// Set the upper and lower margins to 5, left and right margins to 10
padding: [5, 10]
// Set each of the four margins as the followings
padding: [
    5,  // up
    10, // right
    5,  // down
    10, // left
]

orient.descriptionCN:
format of layout, optional values are:

  • 'vertical': vertical layout.
  • 'horizontal': horizontal layout.

inverse.descriptionCN: • Whether to reversely put the timeline, which means put it upside and down.

symbol.descriptionCN:
timelineLabelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: timelineLabel size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: timelineRotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
timelineLabel the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

show.descriptionCN: Whether to show the axis. It could be set as false to not show the axis. It could also be endowed with various styles.

color.descriptionCN:
timeline line color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

label.descriptionCN: There are 2 status text labels of axis, which are normal and emphasis. normal refers to the normal style of text, while emphasis is the highlighted style of text. For instance, emphasis would be adopted as text style for mouse hover and highlighted legend linkage.

position.descriptionCN:
the optional methods of configuration:

  • 'auto': completely automatical deciding.

  • 'left': Put it along the left margin. It is valid as timline.orient is set as 'horizontal' .

  • 'right': It is valid as timline.orient is set as 'horizontal'. Put it along the right margin.

  • 'top': Put it along the margin of the top.

    It is valid as timline.orient is set as 'vertical'.

  • 'bottom': Put it along the margin of the bottom. It is valid as timline.orient is set as 'vertical'.

  • number: When it is assigned with a value, it indicates the distance between label and axis. If it was 0 , label would be coincident with axis. It can be both positive and negtive value, deciding on which side of the axis the location of label would be.

interval.descriptionCN: The interval of label. When it is assigned with a numerical value, such as 2, a label would show every 2 items.

rotate.descriptionCN: the rotation angle of label . Positive values refer to counter clockwise rotation.

formatter.descriptionCN:
The formatter of axi stick label, supporting both string template and callback fuction.

Example:

//using string template, the template variable is the default label of axistick  {value}
formatter: '{value} kg'

// using callback function template, function parameters are individually
formatter: function (value, index) {
    // formatting to be Month/day, the particular year display only in the first scale
    var date = new Date(value);
    var texts = [(date.getMonth() + 1), date.getDate()];
    if (idx === 0) {
        texts.unshift(date.getYear());
    }
    return texts.join('/');
}

color.descriptionCN: timeline.lable.normaltext color.

interval.descriptionCN: The interval of label. When it is assigned with a numerical value, such as 2, a label would show every 2 items.

rotate.descriptionCN: the rotation angle of label . Positive values refer to counter clockwise rotation.

The formatter of axi stick label, supporting both string template and callback fuction.

    // formatting to be Month/day, the particular year display only in the first scale

color.descriptionCN: timeline.lable.emphasistext color.

itemStyle.descriptionCN: timeline graphic pattern, There are two status, normal and emphasis, normal is the normal pattern of a graphic, emphasis is the highlight pattern of a graphic, like the graphic pattern of emphasis when mouse hovers over or legend linkage highlights.

color.descriptionCN:
timeline color of the graphic.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: timeline stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: timeline Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

color.descriptionCN:
timeline color of the graphic.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderWidth.descriptionCN: timeline Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

symbol.descriptionCN:
timeline.checkpointStyle Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: timeline.checkpointStyle Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: timeline.checkpointStyle Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
timeline.checkpointStyle Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

color.descriptionCN: The color ofcurrent item (checkpoint) in timeline component.

borderWidth.descriptionCN: The border-width ofcurrent item (checkpoint) in timeline component.

borderColor.descriptionCN: The border-color ofcurrent item (checkpoint) in timeline component.

animation.descriptionCN: In timeline component, whether there is animation in current item (checkpoint) moving during the process of timeline playing and switching.

animationDuration.descriptionCN: The animation duration ofcurrent item (checkpoint) in timeline component.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: The easing effect of animation ofcurrent item (checkpoint) in timeline component. Different easing effect could refers to easing sample.

controlStyle.descriptionCN: The style ofcontrol button.control buttonincludes: play buttonprevious buttonnext button.

show.descriptionCN: Whether to show control button. When it is set as, it would not show at all.

itemSize.descriptionCN: the size ofcontrol button, and its unit is pixel (px).

itemGap.descriptionCN: the interval betweencontrol button, and its unit is pixel (px).

position.descriptionCN:
the location of control button.

  • As timeline.orient is set as 'horizontal', 'left''right'are valid.

  • As timeline.orient is set as 'vertical', 'top''bottom'are valid.

playIcon.descriptionCN:
the icon of play statusforplay button.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

stopIcon.descriptionCN:
the icon of stop statusforplay button.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

prevIcon.descriptionCN:
the icon of previous button

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

nextIcon.descriptionCN:
the icon of next button

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

normal.descriptionCN: the style of normal statusfor control button.

color.descriptionCN: button color.

borderColor.descriptionCN: the color of button border.

borderWidth.descriptionCN: the border width of button.

emphasis.descriptionCN: the button style in highlighted status (during its hover).

color.descriptionCN: button color.

borderColor.descriptionCN: the color of button border.

borderWidth.descriptionCN: the width of button border.

data.descriptionCN:
timeline data. Every item of Array, it could be a direct numerical. If you need to individually endow each data item with a style definition, the data item should be written as Object. In Object, the attribute of value is numerical value. Other attributes, such as the examples below, could cover the attribute configuration in timeline.

as follows: 

[
    '2002-01-01',
    '2003-01-01',
    '2004-01-01',
    {
        value: '2005-01-01',
        tooltip: {          // Let `tooltip` to be displayed as mouse hovering to this item.
            formatter: '{b} xxxx'
        },
        symbol: 'diamond',  // the special setting of this item's figure.
        symbolSize: 16      // the special setting of this item's size.
    },
    '2006-01-01',
    '2007-01-01',
    '2008-01-01',
    '2009-01-01',
    '2010-01-01',
    {
        value: '2011-01-01',
        tooltip: {          // Let `tooltip` to be displayed as mouse hovering to this item.
            formatter: function (params) {
                return params.name + 'xxxx';
            }
        },
        symbol: 'diamond',
        symbolSize: 18
    },
]

anyOf.descriptionCN:
broken line graph

Broken line graph relates all the data points symbol by broken lines, which is used to show the trend of data changing. It could be used in both rectangular coordinate andpolar coordinate.

Tip: When areaStyle is set, area graph could be drew.

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

coordinateSystem.descriptionCN:
The coordinate used in the series, options are:

  • 'cartesian2d'

    Using a two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate (also known as Cartesian coordinate), through xAxisIndex, yAxisIndex to assign the corresponding axis component.

  • 'polar'

    Using polar coordinates, through polarIndex to assign the corresponding polar coordinate component.

xAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of x axis, which is useful when there are multiple x axes in one graphic chart.

yAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of y axis, which is useful when there are multiple y axes in one graphic chart.

polarIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of Polar coordinate, which is useful when there are multiple polar coordinates in one graphic chart.

symbol.descriptionCN:
Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

If graphic size of every data needs to be different, you can set to the callback function in the following format: 

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

showSymbol.descriptionCN: Whether to show symbol. It would be shown during tooltip hover.

showAllSymbol.descriptionCN: symbol graphic element defaults to be shown on main axis(following the label gap of main axis to hide the strategies). If you want to show them all, set showAllSymbol as true.

hoverAnimation.descriptionCN: Whether to enable the reminding animation effect of hover on inflection point symbol.

legendHoverLink.descriptionCN: Whether to enable joint highlights legend when hover.

stack.descriptionCN:
If stack the value. On the same category axis, the series with the same stack name could stack.

The effect of the below example could be seen through stack switching of toolbox on the top right corner:

clipOverflow.descriptionCN: Whether to clip the overflowing part, which defaults to clip.

label.descriptionCN: text label on the graphic can be used to explain some data information of the graphic, for example, value, name and so on.label is placed in ECharts 2.x under itemStyle.normal. In ECharts 3, in order to make the whole configuration structure more reasonable and flat, labelis taked to the same level as itemStyle and possesses rwo status normal and emphasis like itemStyle.

position.descriptionCN:
Label position.

Followings are the options:

  • [x, y]

    Represent label relative to the graphics on the left corner of bounding box by relative percentage or absolute pixel value. For example: 

      // Absolute pixel values
  position: [10, 10],
  // Relative percent
  position: ['50%', '50%']

  • 'top'

  • 'left'
  • 'right'
  • 'bottom'
  • 'inside'
  • 'insideLeft'
  • 'insideRight'
  • 'insideTop'
  • 'insideBottom'
  • 'insideLeftTop'
  • 'insideLeftBottom'
  • 'insideRightTop'
  • 'insideRightBottom'

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, representing series name, date name, data value respectively.

    example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {c}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: .

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

color.descriptionCN: text color.

itemStyle.descriptionCN: the style of the inflection point of broken line.

color.descriptionCN:
color of the graphic. Get color from the global palette option.color by default.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

Support the use of callback functions. Callback function takes the following forms: 

(params: Object) => Color

Incoming are the data item seriesIndex, dataIndex, data, value and other parameters.

borderColor.descriptionCN: stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

smoothMonotone.descriptionCN:
Whether the broken line could maintain the monotonicity when it becomes smooth. It could be set as 'x', 'y' to confirm that whether it maintains the monotonicity on x axis or y axis.

It is usually used on double-value axis.

Here are 2 examples of broken line graph in double-value axis, showing the differences when smoothMonotone is without any setting, and smoothMonotone is set as 'x'.

  • no setting about smoothMonotone:

  • it is set as 'x':

sampling.descriptionCN:
the dowmsampling strategy used when the data size is much larger than piex dot. It could optimize the drawing efficiency when it is turned on. And it defaults to be turned off, indicating that all the drawing would not filter data point.

Options:

  • 'average' average the value of filter points
  • 'max' maximize the value of filter points
  • 'min' minimize the value of filter points
  • 'sum' sum the values of filter points

data.descriptionCN:
Array of data content in series.Array item usually is specific data item. Followings are three data formats

  1. When an axis in the coordinate is category axis, data can be the value of one dimension, the length of array equals to the length of xAxis.data,which is the label array of category axis content.And there is a one-to-one correspondence between them, for example: 

     [12, 34, 56, 10, 23]

  2. When both axes in the coordinate are value axes, every data item needs one array, and at least two of them should represent x, yin cartesian coordinates or radius, anglein polar coordinates, for example: 

     [[3.4, 4.5, 15], [4.2, 2.3, 20], [10.8, 9.5, 30], [7.2, 8.8, 18]]

    Every array of data value is able to present other data dimensions from the third one, using visualMap component can map one or more assigned dimensions to color, size and other graphic properties.

  3. When both axes in the coordinate are category axes, every data item also needs one array, a single data item needs to have at least two values representing category index or name on two axes, for example: 

     [[0, 0, 2], ['monday', 2, 1], [2, 1, 2], [3, 3, 5]]

    Every array of data value is able to present other data dimensions from the third one, using visualMap component can map one or more assigned dimensions to color, size and other graphic properties.

Examples of double category axis can refer to [Github Punchcard](http://echarts.baidu.com/gallery/editor.html?c=scatter-punchCard).

When it needs to customize certain data label, array item can be treated as subject, among whichvalue stands for specific value, for example: 

[
    12, 34,
    {
        value : 56,
        //self-define label format, only valid for this data item
        label: {},
        //special self-define itemStyle, only valid for this data item
        itemStyle:{}
    },
    10, 23
]

Tip: When data to certain category does not exist (ps: 'inexistence' doesn't mean the value is 0), can use'-'to represent, when there is no data, it should be disconnected in line chart, and no graph in other graphics.

value.descriptionCN: the value of a single data item.

symbol.descriptionCN:
single dataLabelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

data.descriptionCN:
Label data array. Every array is an object, followings are several ways to assign the position the labeling.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

  3. Use type attribute to label the maximum value and minimum value in the series directly.This is when you can use valueIndexto assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions. Or use valueDim to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

For example: 

data: [
    {
        name: 'maximum',
        type: 'max'
    }, 
    {
        name: 'certain coordinate',
        coord: [10, 20]
    }, 
    {
        name: 'cetain screen coordinate',
        x: 100,
        y: 100
    }
]

type.descriptionCN:
special label types are used to label maximum value, minimum value and so on.

Options are:

  • 'min' minimum.
  • 'max' maximum.
  • 'average' average value

valueIndex.descriptionCN: Available when using type it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be 0 (xAxis, radiusAxis), 1 (yAxis, angleAxis), and use the first value axis dimension by default.

valueDim.descriptionCN: Available when using type,it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be the direct name of the dimension, for example, names could be xanglein line chartopenclosein candlestick chart.

coord.descriptionCN:
Coordinate of the label.Coordinates format depends on the coordinate of the series.It could be x, y in grid coordinates, or radius, anglein polar coordinates.

Attention: In ECharts 2.x , xAxis and yAxis will be used to label position in grid coordinates,ECharts 3 is no longer recommended.

x.descriptionCN: screen x coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

color.descriptionCN:
line color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

curveness.descriptionCN: Edge curvature supports the value from 0 to 1, the bigger the value, the greater the curvature.

data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

  3. Use type attribute to label the maximum value and minimum value in the series directly. This is when you can use valueIndex to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions. Or you can use valueDim to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

You can also set the type of the marking line through type , whether it is the maximum value or average value. Likewise, dimensions can be assigned through valueIndex.

data: [
    {
        name: 'Average',
        // Support 'average', 'min', 'max'
        type: 'average'
    },
    [
        {
            // Items of starting point and finishing point share one name
            name: 'Minimum value to maximum value',
            type: 'min'
        },
        {
            type: 'max'
        }
    ],
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two coordinates',
            coord: [10, 20]
        },
        {
            coord: [20, 30]
        }
    ],
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

type.descriptionCN:
special label types are used to label maximum value, minimum value and so on.

Options are:

  • 'min' maximum value.
  • 'max' minimum value.
  • 'average' average value

valueIndex.descriptionCN: Available when using type, it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be 0 (xAxis, radiusAxis), 1 (yAxis, angleAxis) and use the first value axis dimension by default.

valueDim.descriptionCN: Available when using type,it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be the direct name of the dimension, for example, names could be xanglein line chartopenclosein candlestick chart.

coord.descriptionCN:
Coordinates of the starting point or finishing point.Coordinates format depends on the coordinate of the series.It could be x, y in grid coordinates, or radius, anglein polar coordinates.

Attention: In ECharts 2.x , xAxis and yAxis will be used to label position in grid coordinates,ECharts 3 is no longer recommended.

x.descriptionCN: screen x coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

symbol.descriptionCN:
starting pointLabelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: starting pointLabel size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: starting pointRotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
starting pointLabel the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

for example:

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
broken line graph zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
broken line graph all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
bar chart

Bar chart shows different data through the height of a bar, which is used in rectangular coordinate with at least 1 category axis.

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

legendHoverLink.descriptionCN: Whether to enable joint highlights legend when hover.

coordinateSystem.descriptionCN:
The coordinate used in the series, options are:

  • 'cartesian2d'

    Using a two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate (also known as Cartesian coordinate), through xAxisIndex, yAxisIndex to assign the corresponding axis component.

xAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of x axis, which is useful when there are multiple x axes in one graphic chart.

yAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of y axis, which is useful when there are multiple y axes in one graphic chart.

In ECharts 3, in order to make the whole configuration structure more reasonable and flat, labelis taked to the same level as itemStyle and possesses rwo status normal and emphasis like itemStyle.

color.descriptionCN: text color.
Bar color. defaults to acquire colors from global palette option.color .

barBorderWidth.descriptionCN: The bodrder width of bar. defaults to have no border.

barBorderRadius.descriptionCN:
The radius of rounded corner of bar border. Its unit is px. And it supports use array to respectively specify the 4 corner radiuses of the bar.

For example:

barBorderRadius: 5, // consistently set the size of 4 rounded corners
barBorderRadius: [5, 5, 0, 0] // (clockwise upper left, upper right, bottom right and bottom left)

        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

color.descriptionCN: Bar color..

Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

stack.descriptionCN: Name of stack. On the same category axis, the series with the same stack name would stack.

barWidth.descriptionCN: The width of the bar. Adaptive when not specified.

barMaxWidth.descriptionCN: The maximum width of the bar. Adaptive when not specified.

barMinHeight.descriptionCN: The minimum width of bar. It could be used to avoid the following situation: the interaction would be affected when the value of some data item is too small.

barGap.descriptionCN: The gap between bars, defaults to be 30% of the bar width, can be set as a fixed value like 20.

barCategoryGap.descriptionCN: The bar gap between each category of bar, defaults to be 20% of the category gap, can be set as a fixed value.

data.descriptionCN:
Array of data content in series.Array item usually is specific data item. Followings are three data formats

  1. When an axis in the coordinate is category axis, data can be the value of one dimension, the length of array equals to the length of xAxis.data,which is the label array of category axis content.And there is a one-to-one correspondence between them, for example: 

     [12, 34, 56, 10, 23]

  2. When both axes in the coordinate are value axes, every data item needs one array, and at least two of them should represent x, yin cartesian coordinates or radius, anglein polar coordinates, for example: 

     [[3.4, 4.5, 15], [4.2, 2.3, 20], [10.8, 9.5, 30], [7.2, 8.8, 18]]

    Every array of data value is able to present other data dimensions from the third one, using visualMap component can map one or more assigned dimensions to color, size and other graphic properties.

  3. When both axes in the coordinate are category axes, every data item also needs one array, a single data item needs to have at least two values representing category index or name on two axes, for example: 

     [[0, 0, 2], ['monday', 2, 1], [2, 1, 2], [3, 3, 5]]

    Every array of data value is able to present other data dimensions from the third one, using visualMap component can map one or more assigned dimensions to color, size and other graphic properties.

Examples of double category axis can refer to [Github Punchcard](http://echarts.baidu.com/gallery/editor.html?c=scatter-punchCard).

When it needs to customize certain data label, array item can be treated as subject, among whichvalue stands for specific value, for example: 

[
    12, 34,
    {
        value : 56,
        //self-define label format, only valid for this data item
        label: {},
        //special self-define itemStyle, only valid for this data item
        itemStyle:{}
    },
    10, 23
]

Tip: When data to certain category does not exist (ps: 'inexistence' doesn't mean the value is 0), can use'-'to represent, when there is no data, it should be disconnected in line chart, and no graph in other graphics.

value.descriptionCN: The value of a single data item.

label.descriptionCN: The style setting of the text label in a single bar.

position.descriptionCN:
Label position.

Followings are the options:

  • [x, y]

    Represent label relative to the graphics on the left corner of bounding box by relative percentage or absolute pixel value. For example: 

      // Absolute pixel values
  position: [10, 10],
  // Relative percent
  position: ['50%', '50%']

  • 'top'

  • 'left'
  • 'right'
  • 'bottom'
  • 'inside'

symbol.descriptionCN:
Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

If graphic size of every data needs to be different, you can set to the callback function in the following format: 

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

data.descriptionCN:
Label data array. Every array is an object, followings are several ways to assign the position the labeling.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

  3. Use type attribute to label the maximum value and minimum value in the series directly.This is when you can use valueIndexto assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions. Or use valueDim to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

For example: 

data: [
    {
        name: 'maximum',
        type: 'max'
    }, 
    {
        name: 'certain coordinate',
        coord: [10, 20]
    }, 
    {
        name: 'cetain screen coordinate',
        x: 100,
        y: 100
    }
]

type.descriptionCN:
special label types are used to label maximum value, minimum value and so on.

Options are:

  • 'min' minimum.
  • 'max' maximum.
  • 'average' average value

valueIndex.descriptionCN: Available when using type it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be 0 (xAxis, radiusAxis), 1 (yAxis, angleAxis), and use the first value axis dimension by default.

valueDim.descriptionCN: Available when using type,it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be the direct name of the dimension, for example, names could be xanglein line chartopenclosein candlestick chart.

coord.descriptionCN:
Coordinate of the label.Coordinates format depends on the coordinate of the series.It could be x, y in grid coordinates, or radius, anglein polar coordinates.

Attention: In ECharts 2.x , xAxis and yAxis will be used to label position in grid coordinates,ECharts 3 is no longer recommended.

x.descriptionCN: screen x coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.
