data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

  3. Use type attribute to label the maximum value and minimum value in the series directly. This is when you can use valueIndex to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions. Or you can use valueDim to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

You can also set the type of the marking line through type , whether it is the maximum value or average value. Likewise, dimensions can be assigned through valueIndex.

data: [
    {
        name: 'Average',
        // Support 'average', 'min', 'max'
        type: 'average'
    },
    [
        {
            // Items of starting point and finishing point share one name
            name: 'Minimum value to maximum value',
            type: 'min'
        },
        {
            type: 'max'
        }
    ],
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two coordinates',
            coord: [10, 20]
        },
        {
            coord: [20, 30]
        }
    ],
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: finishing pointLabel size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: finishing pointRotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
finishing pointLabel the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

lineStyle.descriptionCN: Format of this data line, lineStyle of starting point and finishing point item will be merged together.

color.descriptionCN:
line color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

curveness.descriptionCN: Edge curvature supports the value from 0 to 1, the bigger the value, the greater the curvature.

label.descriptionCN: Format of this data label,label of starting point and finishing point item will be merged together.

position.descriptionCN:
position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
bar graph zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
bar graph all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
pie chart

The pie chart is mainly used for showing data proportion in the total in different categories. Each radians represents the proportion of data quantity.

Tip: The pie chart is more suitable for presenting the relations such as the percentage of data relative to the total. If you just want to present the different data of various categories, the bar graph is more suggested. Compared to tiny length difference, people is less sensitive to the minor radian difference. Otherwise, it could also be shown as Nightingale chart by allocating the roseType, distinguishing different data through radius.

The below example is the custom Nightingale chart:

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

legendHoverLink.descriptionCN: Whether to enable joint highlights legend when hover.

hoverAnimation.descriptionCN: Whether to enable the zoom animation effects of hover in the sectors.

selectedMode.descriptionCN: Selected mode, indicating whether to support multiple selected objects. It defaults to be closed, supporting Boolean values and string. The optional string value could be 'single' or 'multiple' which respectively indicate single or multiple selecting.

clockwise.descriptionCN: Whether the layout of sectors of pie chart is clockwise.

startAngle.descriptionCN: the start angle, which supports the scale of[0, 360].

minAngle.descriptionCN: the minimum angel of sector. It prevents some sector from being too small bacause the some value is too small, which would influence on interaction.

roseType.descriptionCN:
Whether to show as Nightingale chart, which distinguishs data through radius. There are 2 optional modes:

  • 'radius' area shows the percentage of data, radius shows data size.
  • 'area' when all the sectors share the same area, the data size is shown only through radiuses.

avoidLabelOverlap.descriptionCN:
Whether to enable the strategy to avoid labels overlap. It defaults to be enabled to move the label positions in the case of crowded labels overlap to avoid labels overlap.

If this strategy is unnecessary to be enabled, such as in pie-doughnut, all the labels are compulsoried to be put in the center and the value should be set as false.

label.descriptionCN: pie charttext label on the graphic can be used to explain some data information of the graphic, for example, value, name and so on.label is placed in ECharts 2.x under itemStyle.normal. In ECharts 3, in order to make the whole configuration structure more reasonable and flat, labelis taked to the same level as itemStyle and possesses rwo status normal and emphasis like itemStyle.

position.descriptionCN:
the position of lable.

Options:

  • 'outside'

    the outside of sectors of pie chart, which relates to corresponding sector through visual guide line.

  • 'inside'

    the inside of sectors of pie chart.

  • 'inner' is the same with 'inside'.

  • 'center'

    In the center of pie chart. Reference topie-doughnut example

Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

     // percentage
     percent: number,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

(params: Object) => Color

center.descriptionCN:
The center coordinates of pie chart, the first item of array is the abscissa, the second item is ordinate.

Support set to percentage, the first item when setting to percentage is the width relative to the container, the second item is the height.

Example: 

// Set to absolute pixel values
center: [400, 300]
// Set to relative percent
center: ['50%', '50%']

radius.descriptionCN:
the radius of pie chart, the first item of array is inner radius,the second item is outer radius.

Support set to percentage, equal to half of the smaller item between height and width of the container.

You can set a large inside radius for a Donut chart (Donut chart).

data.descriptionCN:
data content and array in the series.Array item can be a single data value, for example: 

[12, 34, 56, 10, 23]

If other dimensions need to be added to data visualMap component to map color and other graphic properties.Each data item can also be an array, for example: 

[[12, 14], [34, 50], [56, 30], [10, 15], [23, 10]]

Now second value in each arrary can be assigned to visualMap component.

In most situation, we need to assign name to each data item,so each item need to be one subject: 

[{
    // name of date item
    name: 'data1',
    // value of date item is 8
    value: 10
}, {
    name: 'data2',
    value: 20
}]

When personalized definition needs to be conducted to sepcific content: 

[{
    name: 'data1',
    value: 10
}, {
    // name of data item
    name: 'data2',
    value : 56,
    //special self-define tooltip, only valid for this data item
    tooltip:{},
    //special self-define itemStyle, only valid for this data item
    itemStyle:{}
}]

selected.descriptionCN: Whether the data items could be selected.

label.descriptionCN: the label configuration of a single sector.

the position of lable.

    the inside of sectors of pie chart.

  • 'inner' is the same with 'inside'.

  • 'center'

    In the center of pie chart. Reference topie-doughnut example

data.descriptionCN:
Label data array. Every array is an object, followings are several ways to assign the position the labeling.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

For example: 

data: [
    {
        name: 'cetain screen coordinate',
        x: 100,
        y: 100
    }
]

symbol.descriptionCN:
Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

color.descriptionCN:
color of the graphic.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {

        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

data: [
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

anyOf.descriptionCN:
Scatter (bubble) diagram . The scatter diagram in rectangular coordinate could be used to present the relation between x and y. If there are multiple dimensions of a data item, the values of the other dimensions can be displayed as bubble diagram through symbol with various sizes and colors. These can be completed by cooperating with visualMap component.

It could be applied in rectangular coordinate and polar coordinate and geographical coordinate.

Tip: Instead of marking a large number of data points through markPoint in ECharts 2.x, the scatter on geographical coordinate is suggested to achieve the same effect in ECharts 3. The following example shows the distribution of air quality is with a scatter diagram on the map of China. What's more, the visualMap component is used to map PM2.5 to colors.

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

coordinateSystem.descriptionCN:
The coordinate used in the series, options are:

  • 'cartesian2d'

    Using a two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate (also known as Cartesian coordinate), through xAxisIndex, yAxisIndex to assign the corresponding axis component.

  • 'polar'

    Using polar coordinates, through polarIndex to assign the corresponding polar coordinate component.

  • 'geo'

    Using geographic coordinate, through geoIndex to assign the corresponding geographic coordinate components.

xAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of x axis, which is useful when there are multiple x axes in one graphic chart.

yAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of y axis, which is useful when there are multiple y axes in one graphic chart.

polarIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of Polar coordinate, which is useful when there are multiple polar coordinates in one graphic chart.

geoIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of geographic coordinate, which is useful when there are multiple geographic coordinates in one graphic chart.

hoverAnimation.descriptionCN: Whether to enable the reminding animation effect mouse hover.

legendHoverLink.descriptionCN: Whether to enable joint highlights legend when hover.

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

If graphic size of every data needs to be different, you can set to the callback function in the following format: 

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

large.descriptionCN:
Whether to enable the optimization of large-scale scatter diagram. The (>=5k) could be enabled when there is a particularly large number of data graphic elements.

After being enabled, it should coordinate with largeThreshold to optimize the draw when the data volume is greater than specified threshold value.

The style of a single data item can't be custom set and can't interact after optimization.

In ECharts 3, in order to make the whole configuration structure more reasonable and flat, labelis taked to the same level as itemStyle and possesses rwo status normal and emphasis like itemStyle.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

data.descriptionCN:
Array of data content in series.Array item usually is specific data item. Followings are three data formats

  1. When an axis in the coordinate is category axis, data can be the value of one dimension, the length of array equals to the length of xAxis.data,which is the label array of category axis content.And there is a one-to-one correspondence between them, for example: 

     [12, 34, 56, 10, 23]

  2. When both axes in the coordinate are value axes, every data item needs one array, and at least two of them should represent x, yin cartesian coordinates or radius, anglein polar coordinates, for example: 

     [[3.4, 4.5, 15], [4.2, 2.3, 20], [10.8, 9.5, 30], [7.2, 8.8, 18]]

    Every array of data value is able to present other data dimensions from the third one, using visualMap component can map one or more assigned dimensions to color, size and other graphic properties.

  3. When both axes in the coordinate are category axes, every data item also needs one array, a single data item needs to have at least two values representing category index or name on two axes, for example: 

     [[0, 0, 2], ['monday', 2, 1], [2, 1, 2], [3, 3, 5]]

    Every array of data value is able to present other data dimensions from the third one, using visualMap component can map one or more assigned dimensions to color, size and other graphic properties.

Examples of double category axis can refer to [Github Punchcard](http://echarts.baidu.com/gallery/editor.html?c=scatter-punchCard).

When it needs to customize certain data label, array item can be treated as subject, among whichvalue stands for specific value, for example: 

[
    12, 34,
    {
        value : 56,
        //self-define label format, only valid for this data item
        label: {},
        //special self-define itemStyle, only valid for this data item
        itemStyle:{}
    },
    10, 23
]

Tip: When data to certain category does not exist (ps: 'inexistence' doesn't mean the value is 0), can use'-'to represent, when there is no data, it should be disconnected in line chart, and no graph in other graphics.

symbol.descriptionCN:
single dataLabelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: single dataLabel size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: single dataRotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
single dataLabel the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

  position: ['50%', '50%']

data.descriptionCN:
Label data array. Every array is an object, followings are several ways to assign the position the labeling.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

  3. Use type attribute to label the maximum value and minimum value in the series directly.This is when you can use valueIndexto assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions. Or use valueDim to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

For example: 

data: [
    {
        name: 'maximum',
        type: 'max'
    }, 
    {
        name: 'certain coordinate',
        coord: [10, 20]
    }, 
    {
        name: 'cetain screen coordinate',
        x: 100,
        y: 100
    }
]

type.descriptionCN:
special label types are used to label maximum value, minimum value and so on.

Options are:

  • 'min' minimum.
  • 'max' maximum.
  • 'average' average value

valueIndex.descriptionCN: Available when using type it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be 0 (xAxis, radiusAxis), 1 (yAxis, angleAxis), and use the first value axis dimension by default.

valueDim.descriptionCN: Available when using type,it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be the direct name of the dimension, for example, names could be xanglein line chartopenclosein candlestick chart.

coord.descriptionCN:
Coordinate of the label.Coordinates format depends on the coordinate of the series.It could be x, y in grid coordinates, or radius, anglein polar coordinates.

Attention: In ECharts 2.x , xAxis and yAxis will be used to label position in grid coordinates,ECharts 3 is no longer recommended.

x.descriptionCN: screen x coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

  1. string template.

     // data name, category name

     // index of data in the incoming data array

     // Incoming raw data

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

  3. Use type attribute to label the maximum value and minimum value in the series directly. This is when you can use valueIndex to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions. Or you can use valueDim to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

You can also set the type of the marking line through type , whether it is the maximum value or average value. Likewise, dimensions can be assigned through valueIndex.

data: [
    {
        name: 'Average',
        // Support 'average', 'min', 'max'
        type: 'average'
    },
    [
        {
            // Items of starting point and finishing point share one name
            name: 'Minimum value to maximum value',
            type: 'min'
        },
        {
            type: 'max'
        }
    ],
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two coordinates',
            coord: [10, 20]
        },
        {
            coord: [20, 30]
        }
    ],
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

special label types are used to label maximum value, minimum value and so on.

Options are:

  • 'min' maximum value.
  • 'max' minimum value.
  • 'average' average value

valueDim.descriptionCN: Available when using type,it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be the direct name of the dimension, for example, names could be xanglein line chartopenclosein candlestick chart.

coord.descriptionCN:
Coordinates of the starting point or finishing point.Coordinates format depends on the coordinate of the series.It could be x, y in grid coordinates, or radius, anglein polar coordinates.

Attention: In ECharts 2.x , xAxis and yAxis will be used to label position in grid coordinates,ECharts 3 is no longer recommended.

By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

lineStyle.descriptionCN: Format of this data line, lineStyle of starting point and finishing point item will be merged together.

color.descriptionCN:
line color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

curveness.descriptionCN: Edge curvature supports the value from 0 to 1, the bigger the value, the greater the curvature.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

type.descriptionCN:
special label types are used to label maximum value, minimum value and so on.

Options are:

  • 'min' maximum value.
  • 'max' minimum value.
  • 'average' average value

valueIndex.descriptionCN: Available when using type, it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be 0 (xAxis, radiusAxis), 1 (yAxis, angleAxis) and use the first value axis dimension by default.

valueDim.descriptionCN: Available when using type,it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be the direct name of the dimension, for example, names could be xanglein line chartopenclosein candlestick chart.

coord.descriptionCN:
Coordinates of the starting point or finishing point.Coordinates format depends on the coordinate of the series.It could be x, y in grid coordinates, or radius, anglein polar coordinates.

Attention: In ECharts 2.x , xAxis and yAxis will be used to label position in grid coordinates,ECharts 3 is no longer recommended.

x.descriptionCN: screen x coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

symbol.descriptionCN:
finishing pointLabelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
scatter diagram zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
scatter diagram all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
The scatter (bubble) graph with ripple animation. The special animation effect can visually highlights some data.

Tip: The effects of map was achieved through markPoint in ECharts 2.x. However, in ECharts 3, effectScatter on geographic coordinate is recommended for achieving that effects of map.

Here is the example:

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

legendHoverLink.descriptionCN: Whether to enable joint highlights legend when hover.

effectType.descriptionCN: Type of effect. Only ripple effect of 'ripple' is supported currently.

showEffectOn.descriptionCN:
When to show the effect.

Options:

  • 'render' Show the effect when rendering is done.
  • 'emphasis' Show the effect when it is highlight (hover).

scale.descriptionCN: The maximum zooming scale of ripples in animation.

brushType.descriptionCN: The brush type for ripples. options: 'stroke' and 'fill'.

coordinateSystem.descriptionCN:
The coordinate used in the series, options are:

  • 'cartesian2d'

    Using a two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate (also known as Cartesian coordinate), through xAxisIndex, yAxisIndex to assign the corresponding axis component.

  • 'polar'

    Using polar coordinates, through polarIndex to assign the corresponding polar coordinate component.

  • 'geo'

    Using geographic coordinate, through geoIndex to assign the corresponding geographic coordinate components.

xAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of x axis, which is useful when there are multiple x axes in one graphic chart.

yAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of y axis, which is useful when there are multiple y axes in one graphic chart.

polarIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of Polar coordinate, which is useful when there are multiple polar coordinates in one graphic chart.

geoIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of geographic coordinate, which is useful when there are multiple geographic coordinates in one graphic chart.

Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

label.descriptionCN: text label on the graphic can be used to explain some data information of the graphic, for example, value, name and so on.label is placed in ECharts 2.x under itemStyle.normal. In ECharts 3, in order to make the whole configuration structure more reasonable and flat, labelis taked to the same level as itemStyle and possesses rwo status normal and emphasis like itemStyle.

Followings are the options:

  • [x, y]

    Represent label relative to the graphics on the left corner of bounding box by relative percentage or absolute pixel value. For example:

  position: [10, 10],
  // Relative percent
  position: ['50%', '50%']

  • 'top'

itemStyle.descriptionCN: graphic pattern, There are two status, normal and emphasis, normal is the normal pattern of a graphic, emphasis is the highlight pattern of a graphic, like the graphic pattern of emphasis when mouse hovers over or legend linkage highlights.

color.descriptionCN:
color of the graphic. Get color from the global palette option.color by default.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

Support the use of callback functions. Callback function takes the following forms: 

(params: Object) => Color

Incoming are the data item seriesIndex, dataIndex, data, value and other parameters.

borderColor.descriptionCN: stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

for example:

itemStyle: {

        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

data.descriptionCN:
Array of data content in series.Array item usually is specific data item. Followings are three data formats

  1. When an axis in the coordinate is category axis, data can be the value of one dimension, the length of array equals to the length of xAxis.data,which is the label array of category axis content.And there is a one-to-one correspondence between them, for example: 

     [12, 34, 56, 10, 23]

  2. When both axes in the coordinate are value axes, every data item needs one array, and at least two of them should represent x, yin cartesian coordinates or radius, anglein polar coordinates, for example: 

     [[3.4, 4.5, 15], [4.2, 2.3, 20], [10.8, 9.5, 30], [7.2, 8.8, 18]]

    Every array of data value is able to present other data dimensions from the third one, using visualMap component can map one or more assigned dimensions to color, size and other graphic properties.

  3. When both axes in the coordinate are category axes, every data item also needs one array, a single data item needs to have at least two values representing category index or name on two axes, for example: 

     [[0, 0, 2], ['monday', 2, 1], [2, 1, 2], [3, 3, 5]]

    Every array of data value is able to present other data dimensions from the third one, using visualMap component can map one or more assigned dimensions to color, size and other graphic properties.

Examples of double category axis can refer to [Github Punchcard](http://echarts.baidu.com/gallery/editor.html?c=scatter-punchCard).

When it needs to customize certain data label, array item can be treated as subject, among whichvalue stands for specific value, for example: 

[
    12, 34,
    {
        value : 56,
        //self-define label format, only valid for this data item
        label: {},
        //special self-define itemStyle, only valid for this data item
        itemStyle:{}
    },
    10, 23
]

Tip: When data to certain category does not exist (ps: 'inexistence' doesn't mean the value is 0), can use'-'to represent, when there is no data, it should be disconnected in line chart, and no graph in other graphics.

color.descriptionCN: text color.

color of the graphic.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

data.descriptionCN:
Label data array. Every array is an object, followings are several ways to assign the position the labeling.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

  3. Use type attribute to label the maximum value and minimum value in the series directly.This is when you can use valueIndexto assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions. Or use valueDim to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

For example: 

data: [
    {
        name: 'maximum',
        type: 'max'
    }, 
    {
        name: 'certain coordinate',
        coord: [10, 20]
    }, 
    {
        name: 'cetain screen coordinate',
        x: 100,
        y: 100
    }
]

type.descriptionCN:
special label types are used to label maximum value, minimum value and so on.

Options are:

  • 'min' minimum.
  • 'max' maximum.
  • 'average' average value

valueIndex.descriptionCN: Available when using type it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be 0 (xAxis, radiusAxis), 1 (yAxis, angleAxis), and use the first value axis dimension by default.

valueDim.descriptionCN: Available when using type,it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be the direct name of the dimension, for example, names could be xanglein line chartopenclosein candlestick chart.

coord.descriptionCN:
Coordinate of the label.Coordinates format depends on the coordinate of the series.It could be x, y in grid coordinates, or radius, anglein polar coordinates.

Attention: In ECharts 2.x , xAxis and yAxis will be used to label position in grid coordinates,ECharts 3 is no longer recommended.

x.descriptionCN: screen x coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

symbol.descriptionCN:
Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

  3. Use type attribute to label the maximum value and minimum value in the series directly. This is when you can use valueIndex to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions. Or you can use valueDim to assign the maximum value, minimum value and average value in any dimensions.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

You can also set the type of the marking line through type , whether it is the maximum value or average value. Likewise, dimensions can be assigned through valueIndex.

data: [
    {
        name: 'Average',
        // Support 'average', 'min', 'max'
        type: 'average'
    },
    [
        {
            // Items of starting point and finishing point share one name
            name: 'Minimum value to maximum value',
            type: 'min'
        },
        {
            type: 'max'
        }
    ],
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two coordinates',
            coord: [10, 20]
        },
        {
            coord: [20, 30]
        }
    ],
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

radar chart

Radar chart is mainly used to show multivariable data, such as the analysis of football player's each attribute. It relies on radar component.

Here is the sample of AQI which is showed in radar chart.

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

radarIndex.descriptionCN: The index of radar component used in radar chart.

Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). symbolSize.descriptionCN:

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

In ECharts 3, in order to make the whole configuration structure more reasonable and flat, labelis taked to the same level as itemStyle and possesses rwo status normal and emphasis like itemStyle.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
radar chart zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
radar chart all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
Treemap is a common visual way to present hierarchical data tree data.It primarily highlights the important nodes at all hierarchies in Treewith area.

Example:


visual mapping:

treemap firstly map the numberical values to the visual element area.

Moreover, it also map other dimensions of data to colors, lightness of colors and etc..

About the visual setting, see details in series-treemap.levels.




Tip: Compared with ECharts2, Treemap configuration items have changed. Some immature configuration modes are no longer supported or compatible:

  • center/size locate mode is no longer supported, and the locate mode of left/top/bottom/right/width/height would be used uniformly.

  • the configuration of breadcrumb is moved outside the itemStyle.normal/itemStyle.emphasis, which is in the same level with itemStyle.

  • root setting is not avaliable temporarily.At present, zoom could be used to see the details in the subordinate levels.

  • the configuration of label is moved outside the itemStyle.normal/itemStyle.emphasis, which is in the same level with itemStyle.

  • itemStyle.normal.childBorderWidthitemStyle.normal.childBorderColor are not avaliable anymore (because this configuration can only define 2 levels of treemap).series-treemap.levels is used uniformly to define all levels.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

left.descriptionCN:
treemap distance of component from the left side of the container.

left value can be specific pixel value like20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container width like '20%' , and also 'left', 'center', 'right'.

if the left value is'left', 'center', 'right', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

top.descriptionCN:
treemap distance of component from the upper side of the container.

top value can be specific pixel value like 20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%', and also 'top', 'middle', 'bottom'. if the top value is'top', 'middle', 'bottom', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

right.descriptionCN:
treemap distance of component from the right side of the container.

right value can be specific pixel value like 20 ,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

bottom.descriptionCN:
treemap distance of component from the down side of the container.

bottom value can be specific pixel value like 20,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

squareRatio.descriptionCN:
expected square ratio. The layout would approach the ratio as close as possible.

It defaults to be the golden ratio: 0.5 * (1 + Math.sqrt(5)).

roam.descriptionCN:
Whether to enable dragging roam (move and zoom). Optional values are:

  • false: close.
  • 'scale' or 'zoom': zoom only.
  • 'move' or 'pan': translation only.
  • true: both zoom and translation are avaliable.

nodeClick.descriptionCN:
Optional values are:

  • false: no response after node clicking.
  • 'zoomToNode': zooming to node after clicking the node.
  • 'link': if there is link in node data, hyperlink jump would happen after clickong the node.

zoomToNodeRatio.descriptionCN: Clicking on a node, and then this node would automatically zoom in to the suitable ratio (node area ratio of node occuppying the viewing area). This configuration is the ratio.

levels.descriptionCN:
multiple levels configuration

treemap adopts3-level configurationsuch asseries--each level--each node.

Otherwise, we can configurate each node and also can configurate each level of the tree, or set a overall configuration on the series.

The most frequently used one isconfigurate each level, the configuration item of levels is the configuration of each level. For example: 

levels: [
    {...}, // top configuration
    {...}, // configuration of the next level
    {...}, // configuration of the level after the next level
    ...
]


The rules for visual mapping

Treemap primarily focus on how to visually distinguish different levels from different categories in the same level, which require to properly set rectangular color,border thickness, border colorand evencolor saturation of rectangular and so on on each level.

Reference to example. The top level is divided by colors into several parts respectively in redgreenblueand etc.. Each color block is the next level, using color saturation to distinguish (reference to colorSaturation). The border of the outermost level of Rectangle is white. The border of the next level rectangular is the processed result of current block color added with saturation (See borderColorSaturation).

Treemap supports this configuration through the following rule: each level computes visual information (the configuration in levels) of user configuration such ascolorcolorSaturationborderColorcolorSaturation, then pass them to the child node (sublevel). If there is no configuration of child node, the configuration of the parent node would be inherited, or its own configuration would be used.

Therefore, what can be done is the following: the parent level configurates color list, the child level configurates colorSaturation. Each node of parent level would obtain a color from the color list; and the node of child level would obtain a color from colorSaturation and compound it with the color inherited from the parent node to get its final color.


dimensions andextra visual mapping

Example: every value field is an Array, in which every item corresponds with a dimension (dimension).

[
    {
        value: [434, 6969, 8382],
        children: [
            {
                value: [1212, 4943, 5453],
                id: 'someid-1',
                name: 'description of this node',
                children: [...]
            },
            {
                value: [4545, 192, 439],
                id: 'someid-2',
                name: 'description of this node',
                children: [...]
            },
            ...
        ]
    },
    {
        value: [23, 59, 12],
        children: [...]
    },
    ...
]

treemap defalts to map the first dimension (the first item of Array) to area. If users want to express more information, users could map another dimension (series-treemap.visualDimension) to another visual element, such as color lightness and so on. See the status when Growth is selected in legend in the example.


rectangle border/how to avoid confusion with gap setting

If the rectangle gap is set with the same color, there may be confusion when different levels of rectangular display at the same time.

See the example. It should be noticed that the child rectangles in the included red sections are at the deeper level which is different from the level of other rectangles distinguised by white gaps. Therefore, for distinguishing it from other case, we set the gap line color of the rectangular in red section as red color with saturation changein borderColorSaturation.

visualDimension.descriptionCN:
treemap supports visual mapping of other dimensions of data.

First of all, in data format (See series-treemap.data) of treemap, the value of every node could be an array. And every item of an array is adimension (dimension). visualDimension assigns which item would be used in extravisual mapping. It defaults to be the 0 item.

About the visual setting, see details in series-treemap.levels.


Tps: In treemap, visualDimension attribute could exist in much places:

  • It could exist under sereis-treemap root, indicating the unified setting of this overall series.

  • It could exist in every array element of series-treemap.levels, indicating the unified setting of every level of tree.

  • It could exist n every node of series-treemap.data, indicating the particular setting of each node.

color.descriptionCN:
the color list for nodes at the same level. When it defaults to be empty, the color list of system would be choosed.

About the visual setting, see details in series-treemap.levels.


Tps: In treemap, color attribute could exist in much places:

  • It could exist under sereis-treemap root, indicating the unified setting of this overall series.

  • It could exist in every array element of series-treemap.levels, indicating the unified setting of every level of tree.

  • It could exist n every node of series-treemap.data, indicating the particular setting of each node.

colorAlpha.descriptionCN:

colorMappingBy.descriptionCN:
It indicates that what should be based on When the nodes at the same level select from the color list (See the color attribute). Optional values are:

  • 'value':

Map the value of nodes (the series-treemap.data.value) to the color list. The color obtained through this way reflects values of nodes. It could be set with visualDimension attribute and map with that latitudinal value of data.

  • 'index':

Map the index(serial number) of nodes to the color list. Namely, in the same level, the first node select the first color from the color list,and the second node gets the second color. The color obtained through this way could distinguish 2 adjacent nodes easily.

  • 'id':

Map the id (namely series-treemap.data.id) of nodes to the color list. id is assigned by users. It could make sure the consistency that the same id maps to the same color when treemap pass the variable value of setOption. See the example.

About the visual setting, see details in series-treemap.levels.

visibleMin.descriptionCN:
If the area of a rectangular node is less than this value (unit: px square), the node will not display.

Without this limitation, the small nodes will affect the display effect.

About the visual setting, see details in series-treemap.levels.

childrenVisibleMin.descriptionCN:
If the area of a rectangular node is less than this value (unit: px square), the child nodes of this node will not display.

This can hide the details of nodes when the rectangular area is not large enough. When users zoom nodes with mouse, the child node would show if the area is larger than this threshold.

About the visual setting, see details in series-treemap.levels.

color.descriptionCN: the color of rectangle. It defaults to obtain colors from overall palette option.color.

colorAlpha.descriptionCN: the color thickness. The value range is floating-point number between 0 ~ 1.

colorSaturation.descriptionCN: the color saturation of rectangle. The value range is floating-point number between 0 ~ 1.

borderWidth.descriptionCN: the border width of rectangle. There is no border when it is 0.

gapWidth.descriptionCN: the gap width of child rectangle inside a rectangle.

borderColor.descriptionCN: the border color of rectangle, supporting color with different formats.

borderColorSaturation.descriptionCN:
the color saturation of rectangle border. The value range is floating-point number between 0 ~ 1.

Tips:

If this property is set, the borderColor setting is invalid. Instead, the color (such as the color inherited from the parent node) calculated by the current node. The final color would be get when the borderColorSaturation is set on this color value. In this way, different sections have rectangular interval lines with different colorseffect could be produced, easily to distinguish levels.


rectangle border/how to avoid confusion with gap setting

If the rectangle gap is set with the same color, there may be confusion when different levels of rectangular display at the same time.

See the example. It should be noticed that the child rectangles in the included red sections are at the deeper level which is different from the level of other rectangles distinguised by white gaps. Therefore, for distinguishing it from other case, we set the gap line color of the rectangular in red section as red color with saturation changein borderColorSaturation.

breadcrumb.descriptionCN: breadcrumb, showing the path of current node.

left.descriptionCN:
asdf distance of component from the left side of the container.

left value can be specific pixel value like20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container width like '20%' , and also 'left', 'center', 'right'.

if the left value is'left', 'center', 'right', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

top.descriptionCN:
asdf distance of component from the upper side of the container.

top value can be specific pixel value like 20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%', and also 'top', 'middle', 'bottom'. if the top value is'top', 'middle', 'bottom', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

right.descriptionCN:
asdf distance of component from the right side of the container.

right value can be specific pixel value like 20 ,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

bottom.descriptionCN:
asdf distance of component from the down side of the container.

bottom value can be specific pixel value like 20,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

emptyItemWidth.descriptionCN: When is no content in breadcrumb, this minimun width need to be set up.

itemStyle.descriptionCN: graphic pattern, There are two status, normal and emphasis, normal is the normal pattern of a graphic, emphasis is the highlight pattern of a graphic, like the graphic pattern of emphasis when mouse hovers over or legend linkage highlights.

color.descriptionCN:
boxplotcolor of the graphic.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: boxplot stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: boxplotWidth of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

color.descriptionCN: text color.

boxplotcolor of the graphic.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: boxplot stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: boxplotWidth of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

color.descriptionCN: text color.

data.descriptionCN:
the the data format of series-treemap.data is tree. For example: 

[ // tips, the outmost level is an array. It is unnecessary to start from a root node. 
    {
        value: 1212,
        children: [
            {
                value: 2323,    // the value of value field, corresponding to area size.
                                // it could also be array, such as [2323, 43, 55], in which the first item of array corresponds to the area size. 
                                // array is used for extra visual mapping. See details in series-treemp.levels. 
                id: 'someid-1', // id is not something have to be set.
                                // If some node need to be changed by API, it need id to locate. 
                name: 'description of this node', // show the description text in rectangle.
                children: [...],
                label: {        // the special label definition of this node(if necessary)
                    ...         // the format of label refers to series-treemap.label.
                },
                itemStyle: {    // the special itemStyle definition of this node(if necessary).
                    ...         // the format of label refers to series-treemap.itemStyle.
                }
            },
            {
                value: 4545,
                id: 'someid-2',
                name: 'description of this node',
                children: [
                    {
                        value: 5656,
                        id: 'someid-3',
                        name: 'description of this node',
                        children: [...]
                    },
                    ...
                ]
            }
        ]
    },
    {
        value: [23, 59, 12]
        // if there is no children, here could be nothing. 
    },
    ...
]

value.descriptionCN: The value of nodes in each tree, which corresponds to area size. It could be number or array, such as [2323, 43, 55]. So the first item corresponds to the area size.

id.descriptionCN: the id of each tree node. id is not necessarily to be set. If some node need to be changed by API, it needs id to locate.

visualDimension.descriptionCN:
treemap supports visual mapping of other dimensions of data.

First of all, in data format (See series-treemap.data) of treemap, the value of every node could be an array. And every item of an array is adimension (dimension). visualDimension assigns which item would be used in extravisual mapping. It defaults to be the 0 item.

About the visual setting, see details in series-treemap.levels.

  • It could exist n every node of series-treemap.data, indicating the particular setting of each node.

Tps: In treemap, childrenVisibleMin attribute could exist in much places:

  • It could exist under sereis-treemap root, indicating the unified setting of this overall series.

  • It could exist in every array element of series-treemap.levels, indicating the unified setting of every level of tree.

  • It could exist n every node of series-treemap.data, indicating the particular setting of each node.

color.descriptionCN: the color of rectangle. It defaults to obtain colors from overall palette option.color.

colorAlpha.descriptionCN: the color thickness. The value range is floating-point number between 0 ~ 1.

colorSaturation.descriptionCN: the color saturation of rectangle. The value range is floating-point number between 0 ~ 1.

borderWidth.descriptionCN: the border width of rectangle. There is no border when it is 0.

gapWidth.descriptionCN: the gap width of child rectangle inside a rectangle.

borderColor.descriptionCN: the border color of rectangle, supporting color with different formats.

borderColorSaturation.descriptionCN:
the color saturation of rectangle border. The value range is floating-point number between 0 ~ 1.

Tips:

If this property is set, the borderColor setting is invalid. Instead, the color (such as the color inherited from the parent node) calculated by the current node. The final color would be get when the borderColorSaturation is set on this color value. In this way, different sections have rectangular interval lines with different colorseffect could be produced, easily to distinguish levels.


rectangle border/how to avoid confusion with gap setting

If the rectangle gap is set with the same color, there may be confusion when different levels of rectangular display at the same time.

See the example. It should be noticed that the child rectangles in the included red sections are at the deeper level which is different from the level of other rectangles distinguised by white gaps. Therefore, for distinguishing it from other case, we set the gap line color of the rectangular in red section as red color with saturation changein borderColorSaturation.

link.descriptionCN:
Click on the hyperlink which could jump. It is avaliable when the value of series-treemap.nodeClick is 'link'.

See series-treemap.data.target.

target.descriptionCN: The same meaning with target in html <a> label, referring to series-treemap.data.link. Option values are: 'blank' or 'self'.

children.descriptionCN: children node, recursive definition, its format is the same with series-treemap.data.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
Boxplot is a convenient way of graphically depicting groups of numerical data through their quartiles.

Example:


Multiple series are allow to be in the same coordinate axis. Reference to sample.

coordinateSystem.descriptionCN:
The coordinate used in the series, options are:

  • 'cartesian2d'

    Using a two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate (also known as Cartesian coordinate), through xAxisIndex, yAxisIndex to assign the corresponding axis component.

xAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of x axis, which is useful when there are multiple x axes in one graphic chart.

yAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of y axis, which is useful when there are multiple y axes in one graphic chart.

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

legendHoverLink.descriptionCN: Whether to enable joint highlights legend when hover.

hoverAnimation.descriptionCN: Whether to enable the motion effect of hover on box.

layout.descriptionCN:
layout methods, optional values:

  • 'horizontal': horizontal layout of all boxes.

  • 'vertical': vertical layout of all boxes.

The default value is decided by the current situation of coordinate axis: if category is horizontal axis, there would be horizontal layout; otherwise, there would be vertical layout; if there is no category axis, it would be horizontal layout.

boxWidth.descriptionCN:
the limitation of box width. the array means: [min, max].

It could be absolute value, such as [7, 50], and also could be percentage, such as ['40%', '90%']. The percentage means the percentage of the maximum possible width.

itemStyle.descriptionCN: boxplot graphic pattern, There are two status, normal and emphasis, normal is the normal pattern of a graphic, emphasis is the highlight pattern of a graphic, like the graphic pattern of emphasis when mouse hovers over or legend linkage highlights.

color.descriptionCN:
boxplotcolor of the graphic. Get color from the global palette option.color by default.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: boxplot stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: boxplotWidth of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

data.descriptionCN:
Data format is double dimensional array which is shown in the following example.

[
    [655, 850, 940, 980, 1175],
    [672.5, 800, 845, 885, 1012.5],
    [780, 840, 855, 880, 940],
    [621.25, 767.5, 815, 865, 1011.25],
    { // the data item could also be Object, so it could contains special setting values for this data item.

        value: [713.75, 807.5, 810, 870, 963.75],
        itemStyle: {...}
    },
    ...
]

Every data item (each line in the example above) in double dimensional array renders a box, which contains 5 values. They are:

[min,  Q1,  median (or Q2),  Q3,  max]

data processing

the original data processing is not internally installed in ECharts. The data input to boxplot should be the values as above from the 5 statistical results.

However, ECharts also provide extra and simple original data manipulation function. For example, this sample uses echarts.dataTool.prepareBoxplotData to proceed simple data statistics.

value.descriptionCN:
the value of data item.

[min,  Q1,  median (or Q2),  Q3,  max]
