symbol.descriptionCN:
Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

If graphic size of every data needs to be different, you can set to the callback function in the following format: 

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

data.descriptionCN:
Label data array. Every array is an object, followings are several ways to assign the position the labeling.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

For example: 

data: [
    {
        name: 'certain coordinate',
        coord: [10, 20]
    }, 
    {
        name: 'cetain screen coordinate',
        x: 100,
        y: 100
    }
]

valueIndex.descriptionCN: Available when using type it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be 0 (xAxis, radiusAxis), 1 (yAxis, angleAxis), and use the first value axis dimension by default.

valueDim.descriptionCN: Available when using type,it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be the direct name of the dimension, for example, names could be xanglein line chartopenclosein candlestick chart.

coord.descriptionCN:
Coordinate of the label.Coordinates format depends on the coordinate of the series.It could be x, y in grid coordinates, or radius, anglein polar coordinates.

Attention: In ECharts 2.x , xAxis and yAxis will be used to label position in grid coordinates,ECharts 3 is no longer recommended.

x.descriptionCN: screen x coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

data: [
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two coordinates',
            coord: [10, 20]
        },
        {
            coord: [20, 30]
        }
    ],
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

valueIndex.descriptionCN: Available when using type, it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be 0 (xAxis, radiusAxis), 1 (yAxis, angleAxis) and use the first value axis dimension by default.

valueDim.descriptionCN: Available when using type,it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be the direct name of the dimension, for example, names could be xanglein line chartopenclosein candlestick chart.

coord.descriptionCN:
Coordinates of the starting point or finishing point.Coordinates format depends on the coordinate of the series.It could be x, y in grid coordinates, or radius, anglein polar coordinates.

Attention: In ECharts 2.x , xAxis and yAxis will be used to label position in grid coordinates,ECharts 3 is no longer recommended.

x.descriptionCN: screen x coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

symbol.descriptionCN:
starting pointLabelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: starting pointLabel size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: starting pointRotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
starting pointLabel the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

lineStyle.descriptionCN: Format of this data line, lineStyle of starting point and finishing point item will be merged together.

color.descriptionCN:
line color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

curveness.descriptionCN: Edge curvature supports the value from 0 to 1, the bigger the value, the greater the curvature.

label.descriptionCN: Format of this data label,label of starting point and finishing point item will be merged together.

position.descriptionCN:
position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
Box plot zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
Box plot all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
Candlestick is what we usually call K line graph.

ECharts3 supports both 'candlestick' and 'k' which are 2 kinds of 'series.type' ('k' would automatically turns into 'candlestick').

Here is the example:


about the colors ofrisefall:

Different countries or areas define the colors of K line graph differently. It may be red for rise and green for fallorred for rise and blue for fall (such as Mainland China, Taiwan, Japan, Korea and etc.) ; and it may be green for rise and red for fall (such as western countries, Hongkong, Singapore and etc.). It is not necessary to use red and blue, red and green to show rise and fall. Other methods such as colorful/colorlessare also available.

Thre default configuration item isred for rise and blue for fall. If you want to change this color configuration, it should be changed in these configuration items:

  • series-candlestick.itemStyle.normal.color: positive filling color (namelyrise)
  • series-candlestick.itemStyle.normal.color0: negtive filling color (namelyfall)
  • series-candlestick.itemStyle.normal.borderColor: positive border color (namelyrise)
  • series-candlestick.itemStyle.normal.borderColor0: negtive border color (namelyfall)

coordinateSystem.descriptionCN:
The coordinate used in the series, options are:

  • 'cartesian2d'

    Using a two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate (also known as Cartesian coordinate), through xAxisIndex, yAxisIndex to assign the corresponding axis component.

xAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of x axis, which is useful when there are multiple x axes in one graphic chart.

yAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of y axis, which is useful when there are multiple y axes in one graphic chart.

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

legendHoverLink.descriptionCN: Whether to enable joint highlights legend when hover.

hoverAnimation.descriptionCN: Whether to enable the hover animitation on box.

layout.descriptionCN:
layout method, optional values:

  • 'horizontal': horizontal layout of all boxs.

  • 'vertical': vertical layout of all boxs.

The default value is decided by the current situation of coordinate axis: if category is horizontal axis, there would be horizontal layout; otherwise, there would be vertical layout; if there is no category axis, it would be horizontal layout.

itemStyle.descriptionCN: candlestick graphic pattern, There are two status, normal and emphasis, normal is the normal pattern of a graphic, emphasis is the highlight pattern of a graphic, like the graphic pattern of emphasis when mouse hovers over or legend linkage highlights.

color.descriptionCN:
color of positive line .

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

color0.descriptionCN: color of negtive line . It supports the same format of color.

borderColor.descriptionCN: border color of positive line in graph. It supports the same format of color.

borderColor0.descriptionCN: border color of negtive line in graph. It supports the same format of color.

borderWidth.descriptionCN: border width of candlestick. There is no border when it is 0.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

data.descriptionCN:
Data format is double dimensional array which is shown in the following example.

[
    [2320.26, 2320.26, 2287.3,  2362.94],
    [2300,    2291.3,  2288.26, 2308.38],
    { // the data item could also be Object, so it could contains special setting values for this data item.
        value: [2300,    2291.3,  2288.26, 2308.38],
        itemStyle: {...}
    },
    ...
]

Every data item (each line in the example above) in double dimensional array renders a box, which contains 5 values. They are: 

[open, close, lowest, highest]  (namely: [opening value, closing value, lowest value, highest value])

value.descriptionCN:
The value of data item.

[open, close, lowest, highest]  (namely: [opening value, closing value, lowest value, highest value])

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

color.descriptionCN:
color of the graphic.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

Marking the ends of the tag size, it can be one array referring to both ends respectively or in a unified way.

precision.descriptionCN: Numerical precison of marking line is useful when presenting average value line.

label.descriptionCN: Mark line text.

position.descriptionCN:
position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

  2. Use coord attribute assigns coordinates position of data in the corresponding coordinate.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

data: [
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two coordinates',
            coord: [10, 20]
        },
        {
            coord: [20, 30]
        }
    ],
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

valueIndex.descriptionCN: Available when using type, it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be 0 (xAxis, radiusAxis), 1 (yAxis, angleAxis) and use the first value axis dimension by default.

valueDim.descriptionCN: Available when using type,it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be the direct name of the dimension, for example, names could be xanglein line chartopenclosein candlestick chart.

coord.descriptionCN:
Coordinates of the starting point or finishing point.Coordinates format depends on the coordinate of the series.It could be x, y in grid coordinates, or radius, anglein polar coordinates.

Attention: In ECharts 2.x , xAxis and yAxis will be used to label position in grid coordinates,ECharts 3 is no longer recommended.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
K line graph zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
K line graph all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
heat map

Heat map mainly shows the numerical values through colors, which have to coordinate with visualMap component.

It could be applied in both rectangular coordinate and geographic coordinate. The patterns of manifestation in these 2 coordinat system are totally different. There must be 2 category axes used in rectangular coordinate.

Here are the examples applied respectively in rectangular coordinate and geographic coordinate:

rectangular coordinate:

geographic coordinate:

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

coordinateSystem.descriptionCN:
The coordinate used in the series, options are:

  • 'cartesian2d'

    Using a two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate (also known as Cartesian coordinate), through xAxisIndex, yAxisIndex to assign the corresponding axis component.

  • 'geo'

    Using geographic coordinate, through geoIndex to assign the corresponding geographic coordinate components.

xAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of x axis, which is useful when there are multiple x axes in one graphic chart.

yAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of y axis, which is useful when there are multiple y axes in one graphic chart.

geoIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of geographic coordinate, which is useful when there are multiple geographic coordinates in one graphic chart.

data.descriptionCN:
Array of data content in series.Array item usually is specific data item. Followings are three data formats

  1. When an axis in the coordinate is category axis, data can be the value of one dimension, the length of array equals to the length of xAxis.data,which is the label array of category axis content.And there is a one-to-one correspondence between them, for example: 

     [12, 34, 56, 10, 23]

  2. When both axes in the coordinate are value axes, every data item needs one array, and at least two of them should represent x, yin cartesian coordinates or radius, anglein polar coordinates, for example: 

     [[3.4, 4.5, 15], [4.2, 2.3, 20], [10.8, 9.5, 30], [7.2, 8.8, 18]]

    Every array of data value is able to present other data dimensions from the third one, using visualMap component can map one or more assigned dimensions to color, size and other graphic properties.

  3. When both axes in the coordinate are category axes, every data item also needs one array, a single data item needs to have at least two values representing category index or name on two axes, for example: 

     [[0, 0, 2], ['monday', 2, 1], [2, 1, 2], [3, 3, 5]]

    Every array of data value is able to present other data dimensions from the third one, using visualMap component can map one or more assigned dimensions to color, size and other graphic properties.

Examples of double category axis can refer to [Github Punchcard](http://echarts.baidu.com/gallery/editor.html?c=scatter-punchCard).

When it needs to customize certain data label, array item can be treated as subject, among whichvalue stands for specific value, for example: 

[
    12, 34,
    {
        value : 56,
        //self-define label format, only valid for this data item
        label: {},
        //special self-define itemStyle, only valid for this data item
        itemStyle:{}
    },
    10, 23
]

Tip: When data to certain category does not exist (ps: 'inexistence' doesn't mean the value is 0), can use'-'to represent, when there is no data, it should be disconnected in line chart, and no graph in other graphics.

label.descriptionCN: It is valid in rectangular coordinate(coordinateSystem: 'cartesian2d').

Label position.

Followings are the options:

  • [x, y]

    Represent label relative to the graphics on the left corner of bounding box by relative percentage or absolute pixel value. For example: 

      // Absolute pixel values
  position: [10, 10],
  // Relative percent
  position: ['50%', '50%']

  • 'top'

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

symbol.descriptionCN:
Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

If graphic size of every data needs to be different, you can set to the callback function in the following format: 

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

label.descriptionCN: Callout text.

position.descriptionCN:
Label position.

Followings are the options:

  • [x, y]

    Represent label relative to the graphics on the left corner of bounding box by relative percentage or absolute pixel value. For example: 

      // Absolute pixel values
  position: [10, 10],
  // Relative percent
  position: ['50%', '50%']

  • 'top'

  • 'left'
  • 'right'
  • 'bottom'
  • 'inside'
  • 'insideLeft'
  • 'insideRight'
  • 'insideTop'
  • 'insideBottom'
  • 'insideLeftTop'

  • 'insideRightTop'
  • 'insideRightBottom'

    example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {c}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: .

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

precision.descriptionCN: Numerical precison of marking line is useful when presenting average value line.

label.descriptionCN: Mark line text.

position.descriptionCN:
position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

data: [
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

zlevel.descriptionCN:
heat map zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
heat map all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
Map.

Map is maily used in the visulization of geographic area data, which coordinates with visualMap component to show the datas such as population distribution density in diffrent areas.

The same series of multiple map type would show in one map. At this point, the configuration item of the first series should be used as the configuration for map drawing.

Tip: markLine and markPoint are not recommended any more in ECharts 3. If you want to realize the visulization of punctual data and line data, you could use the scatter diagramline graph in geographic coordinate component.

Sample:

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

map.descriptionCN:
Types of maps.

Because the accuracy of maps in ECharts 3 have been improved, the map data for enlarging javascript volume would not been internally installed anymore, you can download the map docs you need from Map download page and then import and register them in ECharts.

2 formats of map data are provided in ECharts, the one is js document which could directly improt script label and then automatically register the map name and data; the other is JSON document which need to be registered manually after being async-loaded by jquery.

There are practical examples of these 2 types:

JavaScript importing example 

<script src="echarts.js"></script>
<script src="map/js/china.js"></script>
<script>
var chart = echarts.init(document.getElmentById('main'));
chart.setOption({
    series: [{
        type: 'map',
        map: 'china'
    }]
});
</script>

JSON importing example 

$.get('map/json/china.json', function (chinaJson) {
    echarts.registerMap('china', chinaJson);
    var chart = echarts.init(document.getElmentById('main'));
    chart.setOption({
        series: [{
            type: 'map',
            map: 'china'
        }]
    });
});

ECharts uses geoJSON format as map outline. Except for the above-mentioned data, you can also gain geoJSON data through other methods and register it in ECharts. Reference to USA Population Estimates

roam.descriptionCN: whether to enable mouse zooming and translation roaming. Disenable by default. If one wants to enable zooming or translation, can set to 'scale' or 'move'. Set to true to enable all.

nameMap.descriptionCN:
Name map with custom region, for instance: 

{
    'China' : 'China'
}

label.descriptionCN: text label on the graphic can be used to explain some data information of the graphic, for example, value, name and so on.label is placed in ECharts 2.x under itemStyle.normal. In ECharts 3, in order to make the whole configuration structure more reasonable and flat, labelis taked to the same level as itemStyle and possesses rwo status normal and emphasis like itemStyle.

show.descriptionCN: Specify whether to show label in usual status.

color.descriptionCN: text color.

show.descriptionCN: Specify whether to show label in highlight status.

color.descriptionCN: text color.

itemStyle.descriptionCN: polygon in map area graphic pattern, There are two status, normal and emphasis, normal is the normal pattern of a graphic, emphasis is the highlight pattern of a graphic, like the graphic pattern of emphasis when mouse hovers over or legend linkage highlights.

color.descriptionCN:
color of the graphic.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

left.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the left side of the container.

left value can be specific pixel value like20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container width like '20%' , and also 'left', 'center', 'right'.

if the left value is'left', 'center', 'right', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

top.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the upper side of the container.

top value can be specific pixel value like 20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%', and also 'top', 'middle', 'bottom'. if the top value is'top', 'middle', 'bottom', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

right.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the right side of the container.

right value can be specific pixel value like 20 ,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

bottom.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the down side of the container.

bottom value can be specific pixel value like 20,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

mapValueCalculation.descriptionCN:
Multiple series containing the same map type would use the same map to shoe. If several series have values in the same area, ECharts would gather the statistics of these values and then get a data. This configuration item refers to the methods applied in configuration statistics, including:

  • 'sum' sum.
  • 'average' averaging.
  • 'max' maximum value.
  • 'min' minimum value.

selectedMode.descriptionCN: selected mode indicating whether to support multiple selected targets, which defaults to be turned off and support boolean value and character string. The value of character string could be 'single' or 'multiple'.

showLegendSymbol.descriptionCN: Show the color symbol of legend in related area (dot of series symbol). Is valid when legend component exists.

data.descriptionCN:
map data content and array in the series.Array item can be a single data value, for example: 

[12, 34, 56, 10, 23]

If other dimensions need to be added to data visualMap component to map color and other graphic properties.Each data item can also be an array, for example: 

[[12, 14], [34, 50], [56, 30], [10, 15], [23, 10]]

Now second value in each arrary can be assigned to visualMap component.

In most situation, we need to assign name to each data item,so each item need to be one subject: 

[{
    // name of date item
    name: 'data1',
    // value of date item is 8
    value: 10
}, {
    name: 'data2',
    value: 20
}]

When personalized definition needs to be conducted to sepcific content: 

[{
    name: 'data1',
    value: 10
}, {
    // name of data item
    name: 'data2',
    value : 56,
    //special self-define tooltip, only valid for this data item
    tooltip:{},
    //special self-define itemStyle, only valid for this data item
    itemStyle:{}
}]

name.descriptionCN: The name of the map area where the data belongs to, such as 'Guangdong' or 'Zhejiang' .

anyOf.descriptionCN:
The series of parallel coordinate.

Introduction of parallel coordinates

parallel coordinates (Parallel Coordinates) is a frequently used data chart of high-dimensional visualization.

For example, following data are in series-parallel.data : 

[
    [1,  55,  9,   56,  0.46,  18,  6,  'good'],
    [2,  25,  11,  21,  0.65,  34,  9,  'excellent'],
    [3,  56,  7,   63,  0.3,   14,  5,  'good'],
    [4,  33,  7,   29,  0.33,  16,  6,  'excellent'],
    { // data item can also be Object, therefore special setting of lines can be included.
        value: [5,  42,  24,  44,  0.76,  40,  16, 'excellent']
        lineStyle: {...},
    }
    ...
]

In data, every line is a data item, every row belongs to adimension. (like every row of data above means: date,AQI index, PM2.5, PM10, carbon monoxide value, nitrogen dioxide value, sulfur dioxide value).

Parallel coordinate is suited to conduct visualization analysis on multidimensional data. Every dimension (row) corresponds to an axis, everydata itemis a line, going through multiple axes. In this axis, data selection and other operations can be carried out, as following:

brief introduction of configuration mode

basic configurations of option inparallel coordinatesare as followed: 

option = {
    parallelAxis: [                     // These are definitions of numerous axis
        {dim: 0, name: schema[0].text}, // Everyaxishas a 'dim' attribute, representing dimension number of axis.
        {dim: 1, name: schema[1].text},
        {dim: 2, name: schema[2].text},
        {dim: 3, name: schema[3].text},
        {dim: 4, name: schema[4].text},
        {dim: 5, name: schema[5].text},
        {dim: 6, name: schema[6].text},
        {dim: 7, name: schema[7].text,
            type: 'category',           //Axis also support category data 
            data: ['Excellent', 'good', 'light pollution', 'moderate pollution', 'heavy pollution', 'severe pollution']
        }
    ],
    parallel: {                         // This is the definition ofcoordinate
        left: '5%',                     // Location setting of parallel coordinate
        right: '13%',
        bottom: '10%',
        top: '20%',
        parallelAxisDefault: {          // Public attribute of axiscan be set here to aviod repeated writing.
            type: 'value',
            nameLocation: 'end',
            nameGap: 20
        }
    },
    series: [                           // These three series share one parallel coordinate
        {
            name: 'Beijing',
            type: 'parallel',           // The type of this series is 'parallel'
            data: [
                [1,  55,  9,   56,  0.46,  18,  6,  'good'],
                [2,  25,  11,  21,  0.65,  34,  9,  'excellent'],
                ...
            ]
        },
        {
            name: 'Shanghai',
            type: 'parallel',
            data: [
                [3,  56,  7,   63,  0.3,   14,  5,  'good'],
                [4,  33,  7,   29,  0.33,  16,  6,  'excellent'],
                ...
            ]
        },
        {
            name: 'Guangzhou',
            type: 'parallel',
            data: [
                [4,  33,  7,   29,  0.33,  16,  6,  'excellent'],
                [5,  42,  24,  44,  0.76,  40,  16, 'excellent'],
                ...
            ]
        }
    ]
};

Three concerned components: parallelparallelAxisseries-parallel

  • parallel

    The configuration item of this parallel coordinate iscoordinateitsel.one series (series) or many series (like BeijingShanghaiGuangzhouin the above picture is a series respectively.) They can share thicoordinate

    The same as other coordinates, multiple coordinates can be created.

    Location setting is also carried out here.

  • parallelAxis

    This is axis configuration of coordinate. Naturally, multiple axes are needed.

    Among which are attributes of parallelAxis.parallelIndex, assigning thisaxisin whichcoordinate. Use the first coordinateby default.

  • series-parallel

    This is the definition ofseries. Series will be drawn tocoordinate.

    Among which are attributes of series-parallel.parallelIndex, assigning usage of whichcoordinate.Use the first coordinateby default.

Configuration note and best practices

When configure multiple parallelAxis, there are some value share the same attribute, If write them multiple times is complicated, then they could be placed in parallel.parallelAxisDefault. Before initializing axis, configuration item in parallelAxisDefault will integrate into parallelAxis respectively, and finally form the configuration of axis.

lines graph

It is used to draw the line data with the information about "from" and "to"; and it is applied fot drawing the air routes on map, which visualizes these routes.

ECharts 2.x uses the markLine from map to draw the migrating effect; while in ECharts 3, the lines graph is recommended to be used individually.

migrating example:

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

coordinateSystem.descriptionCN:
The coordinate used in the series, options are:

  • 'cartesian2d'

    Using a two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate (also known as Cartesian coordinate), through xAxisIndex, yAxisIndex to assign the corresponding axis component.

  • 'geo'

    Using geographic coordinate, through geoIndex to assign the corresponding geographic coordinate components.

xAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of x axis, which is useful when there are multiple x axes in one graphic chart.

yAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of y axis, which is useful when there are multiple y axes in one graphic chart.

geoIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of geographic coordinate, which is useful when there are multiple geographic coordinates in one graphic chart.

effect.descriptionCN:
the setting about special effect of lines.

Tips: All the graphs with contrail effect should be individually put on one layer. It indicates that zlevel need to be individually set up and the animation (animation: false) of this layer is suggested to turn off at the meanwhile. Otherwise, other graphic elements in other series and the label of animation would produce unnecessary shadows.

period.descriptionCN: the duration of special effect, which unit is s.

symbol.descriptionCN:
the symbol of special graph.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

The above example is the graphic elements which present plane by default the symbol of path.

Tip: the angle of symbol changes as the tangent line of track changes. If you use the symbol of default path, you should make sure that the path graphic elements are upward oriented. It would ensure that the graphic elements always move toward the right moving direction when the symbol moves along the track.

symbolSize.descriptionCN: the symbol size of special effect, which could be set as single number such as 10. What's more, arrays could be used to decribe the height and width respectively. For instance, [20, 10] indicates 20 for width and 10 for height.

color.descriptionCN: the color of special effect symbol, which defaults to be lineStyle.normal.color.

trailLength.descriptionCN: the length of contrails of special effect. The values from 0 to 1 could be set. It would be longer as the the value becomes larger.

line color. get color from option.color palette by default

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

symbol.descriptionCN:
Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

If graphic size of every data needs to be different, you can set to the callback function in the following format: 

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:

By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

precision.descriptionCN: Numerical precison of marking line is useful when presenting average value line.

position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

data: [

            y: 100

            y: 200

]

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
lines graph zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
lines graph all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

data.descriptionCN:
the data set of lines.

Every data item is an array, the first item in the array is starting position, the second is finishing position. Through attribute coord you can assign position in the corresponding coordinate.

For example: 

data: [
    [{
        coord: [10, 20],
        // numerical magnitude
        value: 10
    }, {
        coord: [20, 30]
    }]
]

coord.descriptionCN: the coordinate of starting point, which could be the [x, y] in rectangular coordinate and [lng, lat] in geographic coordinate.

lineStyle.descriptionCN: the line style of this data item. the lineStyle of both the start and end points would be combined together.

line color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
relation graph

Graph is a diagram to represent nodes and the links connecting nodes.

Tips: In ECharts 2.x , the diagram of force type will not be available in ECharts 3 any more, which has been changed to use graph to show graph data. If you want to use force to lead the layout, you can set the layout configuration as 'force'.

Example:

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

legendHoverLink.descriptionCN: Whether to enable joint highlights legend when hover.

coordinateSystem.descriptionCN:
The coordinate used in the series, options are:

  • 'cartesian2d'

    Using a two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate (also known as Cartesian coordinate), through xAxisIndex, yAxisIndex to assign the corresponding axis component.

  • 'polar'

    Using polar coordinates, through polarIndex to assign the corresponding polar coordinate component.

  • 'geo'

    Using geographic coordinate, through geoIndex to assign the corresponding geographic coordinate components.

xAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of x axis, which is useful when there are multiple x axes in one graphic chart.

yAxisIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of y axis, which is useful when there are multiple y axes in one graphic chart.

polarIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of Polar coordinate, which is useful when there are multiple polar coordinates in one graphic chart.

geoIndex.descriptionCN: Using the index of geographic coordinate, which is useful when there are multiple geographic coordinates in one graphic chart.

hoverAnimation.descriptionCN: Whether to enable the highlight animation effect of mousr hover node.

layout.descriptionCN:
Graph layout.

Options:

  • 'none' No any layout, use x, y provided in node as the position of node.

  • 'circular' Adopt circular layout, see the example Les Miserables.

  • 'force' Adopt force-directed layout, see the example Force, the detail about configrations of layout are in graph.force

force.descriptionCN:
Configuration items about force-directed layout. Force-directed layout simulates spring/charge model, which will add a repulsion between 2 nodes and add a attraction between 2 nodes of each edge. In each iteration nodes will move under the effect of repulsion and attraction. After several iterations, the nodes will be static in a balanced position. As a result, the energy local minimum of this whole model will be realized.

The result of force-directed layout has a good symmetries and clustering, which is also aesthetically pleasing.

initLayout.descriptionCN:
The initial layout before force-directed layout, which will influence on the result of force-directed layout.

It defaults not to do any layout and use x, y provided in node as the position of node. If it doesn't exist, the position will be generated randomly.

You can also use circular layout 'circular'.

repulsion.descriptionCN: The repulsion factor between nodes. The repulsion will be stronger and the distance between 2 nodes becomes further as this value becomes larger.

gravity.descriptionCN: The gravity factor enforcing nodes approach to the center. The nodes will be closer to the center as the value becomes larger.

edgeLength.descriptionCN: The distance between 2 nodes on edge. This distance is also affected by repulsion.

layoutAnimation.descriptionCN: Because the force-directed layout will be steady after several iterations, this parameter will be decide whether to show the iteration animation of layout. It is not recommended to be close on browser when there are a lot of node data (>100) as the layout process will cause browser to hang.

roam.descriptionCN: whether to enable mouse zooming and translation roaming. Disenable by default. If one wants to enable zooming or translation, can set to 'scale' or 'move'. Set to true to enable all.

nodeScaleRatio.descriptionCN: Related zooming ratio of nodes when mouse zooming in or out. When it is set as 0, the node will not zoom as the mouse zooms.

draggable.descriptionCN: If node is draggable. Only available in force-directed layout.

symbol.descriptionCN:
node of relation graphLabelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
node of relation graphLabel size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

If graphic size of every data needs to be different, you can set to the callback function in the following format: 

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: node of relation graphRotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
node of relation graphLabel the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

edgeSymbol.descriptionCN:
Symbol of two ends of edge line.

For example:

edgeSymbol: ['circle', 'arrow']

edgeSymbolSize.descriptionCN:
Size of symbol of two ends of edge line. Can be an array or a single number.

For example:

// Start symbol has size 5 and end symbol has size 10
symbolSize: [5, 10],
// All has size 10
symbolSize: 10

itemStyle.descriptionCN: graphic pattern, There are two status, normal and emphasis, normal is the normal pattern of a graphic, emphasis is the highlight pattern of a graphic, like the graphic pattern of emphasis when mouse hovers over or legend linkage highlights.

color.descriptionCN:
color of the graphic. Get color from the global palette option.color by default.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

Support the use of callback functions. Callback function takes the following forms: 

(params: Object) => Color

Incoming are the data item seriesIndex, dataIndex, data, value and other parameters.

borderColor.descriptionCN: stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

label.descriptionCN: text label on the graphic can be used to explain some data information of the graphic, for example, value, name and so on.label is placed in ECharts 2.x under itemStyle.normal. In ECharts 3, in order to make the whole configuration structure more reasonable and flat, labelis taked to the same level as itemStyle and possesses rwo status normal and emphasis like itemStyle.

position.descriptionCN:
Label position.

Followings are the options:

  • [x, y]

    Represent label relative to the graphics on the left corner of bounding box by relative percentage or absolute pixel value. For example: 

      // Absolute pixel values
  position: [10, 10],
  // Relative percent
  position: ['50%', '50%']

  • 'top'

  • 'left'
  • 'right'
  • 'bottom'
  • 'inside'
  • 'insideLeft'
  • 'insideRight'
  • 'insideTop'
  • 'insideBottom'
  • 'insideLeftTop'
  • 'insideLeftBottom'
  • 'insideRightTop'
  • 'insideRightBottom'

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

data.descriptionCN:
data content and array in the series.Array item can be a single data value, for example: 

[12, 34, 56, 10, 23]

If other dimensions need to be added to data visualMap component to map color and other graphic properties.Each data item can also be an array, for example: 

[[12, 14], [34, 50], [56, 30], [10, 15], [23, 10]]

Now second value in each arrary can be assigned to visualMap component.

In most situation, we need to assign name to each data item,so each item need to be one subject: 

[{
    // name of date item
    name: 'data1',
    // value of date item is 8
    value: 10
}, {
    name: 'data2',
    value: 20
}]

When personalized definition needs to be conducted to sepcific content: 

[{
    name: 'data1',
    value: 10
}, {
    // name of data item
    name: 'data2',
    value : 56,
    //special self-define tooltip, only valid for this data item
    tooltip:{},
    //special self-define itemStyle, only valid for this data item
    itemStyle:{}
}]

category.descriptionCN: Index of category which the data item belongs to.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

symbol.descriptionCN:
Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

If graphic size of every data needs to be different, you can set to the callback function in the following format: 

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

label.descriptionCN: Callout text.

position.descriptionCN:
Label position.

Followings are the options:

  • [x, y]

    Represent label relative to the graphics on the left corner of bounding box by relative percentage or absolute pixel value. For example: 

      // Absolute pixel values
  position: [10, 10],
  // Relative percent
  position: ['50%', '50%']

  • 'top'

  • 'left'
  • 'right'
  • 'bottom'
  • 'inside'
  • 'insideLeft'
  • 'insideRight'
  • 'insideTop'
  • 'insideBottom'
  • 'insideLeftTop'
  • 'insideLeftBottom'
  • 'insideRightTop'
  • 'insideRightBottom'

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, representing series name, date name, data value respectively.

    example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {c}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: .

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

color.descriptionCN: text color.

color of the graphic.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

data.descriptionCN:
Label data array. Every array is an object, followings are several ways to assign the position the labeling.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

For example: 

data: [
    {
        name: 'cetain screen coordinate',
        x: 100,
        y: 100
    }
]

symbol.descriptionCN: Marking the ends of the tag type, it can be one array referring to both ends respectively or in a unified way, specific format can refer to (~series-graph.markLine.data.0.symbol).

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Marking the ends of the tag size, it can be one array referring to both ends respectively or in a unified way.

Attention: In here, you can not assign height and width through array like the usual symbolSize.

precision.descriptionCN: Numerical precison of marking line is useful when presenting average value line.

label.descriptionCN: Mark line text.

position.descriptionCN:
position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

position.descriptionCN:
position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

data: [
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

left.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the left side of the container.

left value can be specific pixel value like20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container width like '20%' , and also 'left', 'center', 'right'.

if the left value is'left', 'center', 'right', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

top.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the upper side of the container.

top value can be specific pixel value like 20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%', and also 'top', 'middle', 'bottom'. if the top value is'top', 'middle', 'bottom', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

right.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the right side of the container.

right value can be specific pixel value like 20 ,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

bottom.descriptionCN:
distance of component from the down side of the container.

bottom value can be specific pixel value like 20,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

self-adaptive by default.

color.descriptionCN:
Color list of palette. If there is no color setting for node type, it will adopt colors sequentially and circularly from this list.

Defaults:

['#c23531', '#314656', '#61a0a8', '#dd8668', '#91c7ae', '#6e7074', '#61a0a8', '#bda29a', '#44525d', '#c4ccd3']

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
sankey graph

It is a kind of special flow graph, which is mainly used to present how raw materials, energy and so on from the initial status to the final form after processing and transformation.

Example:


visible coding:

The sankey graph encodes each node of the original data into a small rectangular. And different nodes are presented in different colors. The label coding next to the small rectangular is the name of the node.

In addition, the edge coding between two small rectangulars in the graph is the link of the original data. The thickness coding of edge is the valueof link.

zlevel.descriptionCN:
zlevel value of all graphic elements.

zlevelis used to layer Canvas, graphic elements of different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvas, layering Canvas is a common optimization technique. We can set configurations of some frequently changed graphic elements(like animations) to a single zlevel. Please noted that too much Canvas will increase greater memory overhead, and this needs to be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid bread down.

Canvas with bigger zlevel will be placed in Canvas with smaller zlevel.

z.descriptionCN:
all graphic elements z value of components. Control graphic elements sequence. Graphic elements with smaller z value will be overrided by ones with bigger z value.

Compared to zlevel, z has lower priority,and it will not create new Canvas.

left.descriptionCN:
sankey distance of component from the left side of the container.

left value can be specific pixel value like20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container width like '20%' , and also 'left', 'center', 'right'.

if the left value is'left', 'center', 'right', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

top.descriptionCN:
sankey distance of component from the upper side of the container.

top value can be specific pixel value like 20 , it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%', and also 'top', 'middle', 'bottom'. if the top value is'top', 'middle', 'bottom', component will align automatically based on cooresponding position.

right.descriptionCN:
sankey distance of component from the right side of the container.

right value can be specific pixel value like 20 ,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

bottom.descriptionCN:
sankey distance of component from the down side of the container.

bottom value can be specific pixel value like 20,it can also be relative percentage to the container height and width like '20%'.

nodeWidth.descriptionCN: the node width of rectangle in graph.

nodeGap.descriptionCN: the gap between any 2 regtangles in each row from the graph.

layoutIterations.descriptionCN:
the iterations of layout, which is used to continuously optimize the nodes' positions in graph, decreasing the overlapping between nodes and edges.

the default iterations of layout: 32.

The test shows that iterations of layout could not be less than the default value.

label.descriptionCN: label describes the text style in each rectangular node.

position.descriptionCN:
Label position.

Followings are the options:

  • [x, y]

    Represent label relative to the graphics on the left corner of bounding box by relative percentage or absolute pixel value. For example: 

      // Absolute pixel values
  position: [10, 10],
  // Relative percent
  position: ['50%', '50%']

  • 'top'

  • 'left'
  • 'right'
  • 'bottom'
  • 'inside'
  • 'insideLeft'
  • 'insideRight'
  • 'insideTop'
  • 'insideBottom'
  • 'insideLeftTop'
  • 'insideLeftBottom'
  • 'insideRightTop'
  • 'insideRightBottom'

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .
