color.descriptionCN:
color of the graphic. Get color from the global palette option.color by default.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

data.descriptionCN:
data content and array in the series.Array item can be a single data value, for example: 

[12, 34, 56, 10, 23]

If other dimensions need to be added to data visualMap component to map color and other graphic properties.Each data item can also be an array, for example: 

[[12, 14], [34, 50], [56, 30], [10, 15], [23, 10]]

Now second value in each arrary can be assigned to visualMap component.

In most situation, we need to assign name to each data item,so each item need to be one subject: 

[{
    // name of date item
    name: 'data1',
    // value of date item is 8
    value: 10
}, {
    name: 'data2',
    value: 20
}]

When personalized definition needs to be conducted to sepcific content: 

[{
    name: 'data1',
    value: 10
}, {
    // name of data item
    name: 'data2',
    value : 56,
    //special self-define tooltip, only valid for this data item
    tooltip:{},
    //special self-define itemStyle, only valid for this data item
    itemStyle:{}
}]

anyOf.descriptionCN:
Funnel chart

sample:

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

minSize.descriptionCN:
The mapped width from minimum data value min.

It can be absolute pixel and also the percentage of layout width. If you don't want the graph of minimum value to be a triangle, you can set up this property larger than 0.

maxSize.descriptionCN:
The mapped width from maximum data value max.

It can be absolute pixel and also the percentage of layout width.

sort.descriptionCN: Data sorting, which can be whether 'ascending' or 'descending'.

legendHoverLink.descriptionCN: Whether to enable joint highlights legend when hover.

funnelAlign.descriptionCN: Horizontal align. Defaults to align center. Can be 'left', 'right', 'center'.

label.descriptionCN: funnel charttext label on the graphic can be used to explain some data information of the graphic, for example, value, name and so on.label is placed in ECharts 2.x under itemStyle.normal. In ECharts 3, in order to make the whole configuration structure more reasonable and flat, labelis taked to the same level as itemStyle and possesses rwo status normal and emphasis like itemStyle.

position.descriptionCN:
Label position.

Options:

  • 'left'

    Left side of funnel chart. The corresponding trapezoid would be related to through visual guide line.

  • 'right'

    Right side of funnel chart. The corresponding trapezoid would be related to through visual guide line.

  • 'inside'

    Inside the trapezoid of funnel chart.

  • 'inner' equals to 'inside'.

  • 'center' equals to 'inside'.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

     // percentage
     percent: number,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

color of the graphic. Get color from the global palette option.color by default.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

Support the use of callback functions. Callback function takes the following forms: 

(params: Object) => Color

Incoming are the data item seriesIndex, dataIndex, data, value and other parameters.

        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10

}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

symbol.descriptionCN:
Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

If graphic size of every data needs to be different, you can set to the callback function in the following format: 

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

label.descriptionCN: Callout text.

position.descriptionCN:
Label position.

Followings are the options:

  • [x, y]

    Represent label relative to the graphics on the left corner of bounding box by relative percentage or absolute pixel value. For example: 

      // Absolute pixel values
  position: [10, 10],
  // Relative percent
  position: ['50%', '50%']

  • 'top'

  • 'left'
  • 'right'
  • 'bottom'
  • 'inside'
  • 'insideLeft'
  • 'insideRight'
  • 'insideTop'
  • 'insideBottom'
  • 'insideLeftTop'
  • 'insideLeftBottom'
  • 'insideRightTop'
  • 'insideRightBottom'

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, representing series name, date name, data value respectively.

    example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {c}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: .

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

color.descriptionCN: text color.

color of the graphic.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

borderColor.descriptionCN: stroke color of graphic. Support the same format as color

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

Label data array. Every array is an object, followings are several ways to assign the position the labeling.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

For example:

    {
        name: 'cetain screen coordinate',
        x: 100,
        y: 100
    }
]

symbol.descriptionCN: Marking the ends of the tag type, it can be one array referring to both ends respectively or in a unified way, specific format can refer to (~series-funnel.markLine.data.0.symbol).

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Marking the ends of the tag size, it can be one array referring to both ends respectively or in a unified way.

Attention: In here, you can not assign height and width through array like the usual symbolSize.

precision.descriptionCN: Numerical precison of marking line is useful when presenting average value line.

label.descriptionCN: Mark line text.

position.descriptionCN:
position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.

data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

data: [
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

anyOf.descriptionCN:
Gauge chart

Example:

name.descriptionCN: series name is used to present tooltip and legend filter of legend. When updating data and configuration item of setOption,series name is used to assign corresponding series.

radius.descriptionCN:
The radius of gauge chart. It can be a percentage value of the smaller of container half width and half height, also can be an absolute value.

{{ use partial-legend-hover-link }}

startAngle.descriptionCN: The start angle of gauge chart. The direct right side of circle center is 0 degree, the right above it is 90 degree, the direct left side of it is 180 degree.

clockwise.descriptionCN: Whether the scale in gauge chart increases clockwise.

min.descriptionCN: The minimum data value which map to minAngle.

max.descriptionCN: The maximum data value which map to maxAngle.

splitNumber.descriptionCN: The number of split segments of gauge chart scale.

axisLine.descriptionCN: The related configuration about the axis line of gauge chart.

show.descriptionCN: Whether to show the axis line of gauge chart.

lineStyle.descriptionCN: The style of the axis line of gauge chart.

color.descriptionCN:
The axis line of gauge chart can be divided to several segments in different colors. The end position and color of each segment can be expressed by an array.

Default value:

[[0.2, '#91c7ae'], [0.8, '#63869e'], [1, '#c23531']]

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

length.descriptionCN: The length of split line, can be a pecentage value relative to radius.

color.descriptionCN:
line color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

formatter.descriptionCN:
The content formatter of scale label, which supports both string template and callback function. Example:

// use string template. the template variable {value} represent the default label text
formatter: '{value} kg'

// use function callback. the function parameters are scale values.
formatter: function (value) {
    return value + 'km/h';
}

color.descriptionCN: text color.
The scale color

color.descriptionCN: The color of pointer. Defaults to use the color of section where the numerical value belongs to.

borderWidth.descriptionCN: Width of stroke. No stroke when it is 0 .

offsetCenter.descriptionCN: The offset position relative to the center of gauge chart. The first item of array is the horizontal offset; the second item of array is the vertical offset. It could be absolute value and also the percentage relative to the radius of gauge chart.

color.descriptionCN: text color.

detail.descriptionCN: The detail about gauge chart which is used to show data.

borderWidth.descriptionCN: The border width of detail.

borderColor.descriptionCN: The border color of detail.

offsetCenter.descriptionCN: The offset position relative to the center of gauge chart. The first item of array is the horizontal offset; the second item of array is the vertical offset. It could be absolute value and also the percentage relative to the radius of gauge chart.

color.descriptionCN: The text color. Defaults to use the color of section where the numerical value belongs to.

symbol.descriptionCN:
Labelled graphic.

You can choose the marking type, there are 'circle', 'rect', 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow'

you can also set to picture through 'image://url' , in which url is the link to a picture.

In ECharts 3, you can set to any vector paths through 'path://' , and you need not to worry about the serrate or blurriness cause the zoom comparing to the pictures, what's more you can set to any color.Path graphics will adjust to appropriate size automatically ( symbol as in symbolSize). Path format can refer to SVG PathData. You can also edit and extract it from tools such as Adobe Illustrator.

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Label size can set to single number as 10, or use array to represent height and width, such as [20, 10] meaning labelled width is20, height is10.

If graphic size of every data needs to be different, you can set to the callback function in the following format: 

(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array

Among which the first parameter value is the data value in data. The second parameter paramsis the parameter of other data item.

symbolRotate.descriptionCN: Rotation angle of the label.Please noted that in markLine,when symbol is 'arrow' , one usually ingore that symbolRotate will be forced to set to tangent angle.

symbolOffset.descriptionCN:
Label the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

label.descriptionCN: Callout text.

position.descriptionCN:
Label position.

Followings are the options:

  • [x, y]

    Represent label relative to the graphics on the left corner of bounding box by relative percentage or absolute pixel value. For example: 

      // Absolute pixel values
  position: [10, 10],
  // Relative percent
  position: ['50%', '50%']

  • 'top'

  • 'left'
  • 'right'
  • 'bottom'
  • 'inside'
  • 'insideLeft'
  • 'insideRight'
  • 'insideTop'
  • 'insideBottom'
  • 'insideLeftTop'
  • 'insideLeftBottom'
  • 'insideRightTop'
  • 'insideRightBottom'

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, representing series name, date name, data value respectively.

    example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {c}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: .

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

data.descriptionCN:
Label data array. Every array is an object, followings are several ways to assign the position the labeling.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

For example: 

data: [
    {
        name: 'cetain screen coordinate',
        x: 100,
        y: 100
    }
]

x.descriptionCN: screen x coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

symbol.descriptionCN: Marking the ends of the tag type, it can be one array referring to both ends respectively or in a unified way, specific format can refer to (~series-gauge.markLine.data.0.symbol).

symbolSize.descriptionCN:
Marking the ends of the tag size, it can be one array referring to both ends respectively or in a unified way.

Attention: In here, you can not assign height and width through array like the usual symbolSize.

precision.descriptionCN: Numerical precison of marking line is useful when presenting average value line.

label.descriptionCN: Mark line text.

position.descriptionCN:
position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

position.descriptionCN:
position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

data\r.descriptionCN:
Data array of marking line. Every array can be one with one or two value, representing starting point and finishing point of the line, and every item is an object, followings are several ways to assign the positions of starting point and finishing point.

  1. Through x, y attribute assigns screen coorditaes and per pixel of relative container.

When multiple attributes exist simultaneously, the order of priority is as described above.

data: [
    [
        {
            name: 'Marking line between two screen coordinates',
            x: 100,
            y: 100
        },
        {
            x: 500,
            y: 200
        }
    ]
]

x.descriptionCN: screen x coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

y.descriptionCN: screen y coordinate of relative container, per pixel.

finishing pointLabel the offset relative to the original location. By default, label will be centrally placed in corresponding location, but if symbol is custom vector path or picture , there is a chance that symbol would not be wanted to be in the center. Then the configuration item can be used to configure symbol to offset relative to origin center. This can be absolute pixel value or relative percentage.

For example [0, '50%']moves half way up, when symbol praphic is bubble, arrow beneath the graphic can be pointed to data point.

lineStyle.descriptionCN: Format of this data line, lineStyle of starting point and finishing point item will be merged together.

color.descriptionCN:
line color.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

shadowBlur.descriptionCN:
Size of blurriness of graphic shadow. This attribute sets graphic shadow effect together with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY.

for example:

itemStyle: {
    normal: {
        shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
        shadowBlur: 10
    }
}

shadowOffsetX.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of the shade.

shadowOffsetY.descriptionCN: Offset distance on the vertical direction of the shade.

opacity.descriptionCN: Graphic transparency. Support number from 0 to 1, and this graphic will not be drawn when transparency is 0.6

curveness.descriptionCN: Edge curvature supports the value from 0 to 1, the bigger the value, the greater the curvature.

label.descriptionCN: Format of this data label,label of starting point and finishing point item will be merged together.

position.descriptionCN:
position of label can be:

  • 'start' starting point of the line.
  • 'end' finishing point of the line.

formatter.descriptionCN:
Data label formatter supoports string template and callback function.

  1. string template.

    Model variation includes {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, representing series name, data name, data value and percent respectively. example: 

     formatter: '{b}: {d}'

  2. callback function.

    Format of callback function: 

     (params: Object|Array) => string

    parameter params is the single dataset that formatter needs.Format is as followed: 

     {
     // series in the incoming option.index in series
     seriesIndex: number,
     // Series name
     seriesName: string,
     // data name, category name
     name: string,
     // index of data in the incoming data array
     dataIndex: number,
     // Incoming raw data
     data: Object,
     // Incoming data values
     value: number|Array,

 }

formatter return string supports line feed with\n .

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.
Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.

color.descriptionCN:
The color list of palette. If no color is set in series, the colors would be adopted sequentially and circularly from this list as the colors of series.

Defaults:

['#c23531','#2f4554', '#61a0a8', '#d48265', '#91c7ae','#749f83',  '#ca8622', '#bda29a','#6e7074', '#546570', '#c4ccd3']

backgroundColor.descriptionCN:
Background color. Defaults to have no background.

color can be represented by RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)', if you want to add alpha channel, you can use RGBA, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)', you can also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'.

color.descriptionCN: text color.

animationEasing.descriptionCN: Easing effect of initial animation.Different easing effects can refer to easing effect.
